original: @482a / /de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje snying po la sogs pas yang mchod pa byas nas phyag 'tshal te 'di skad ces gsol to; ;thig ler thig le dag gis don //
analyzed: @482a / /de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje snying po la sogs pas yang mchod pa byas nas phyag 'tshal te 'di skad ces gsol to; ;thig ler thig le dag gis don //
translated: Having taught the meaning of the drop with the drops,

original: gtan phab yang dag gsal gsungs nas //
analyzed: gtan phab yang dag gsal gsungs nas //
translated: and having ascertained the perfect clarity,

original: bdag gi dbus su rang byung bas //
analyzed: bdag gi dbus su rang byung bas //
translated: it arises by itself in the middle of the self.

original: des na rang byung brjod par bya //🔽rang byung zhes bya @482b byang  chen gyi //
analyzed: des na rang byung brjod par bya // rang byung zhes bya @482b byang  chen gyi //
translated: Therefore, the self-arisen should be expressed.🔽The meaning of the so-called self-arisen

original: don ni rjes su dpag bya'i phyir //
analyzed: don ni rjes su dpag bya'i phyir //
translated: is to be inferred by the great vehicle.

original: 'di ni rang byung bcom ldan 'das //🔽gcig pu nyid ni lhag pa'i lha //
analyzed: 'di ni rang byung bcom ldan 'das // gcig pu nyid ni lhag pa'i lha //
translated: This self-arisen Bhagavān🔽is the supreme deity, the sole one.

original: lhag pa'i lha zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: lhag pa'i lha zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The so-called supreme deity

original: gong du gsungs pa'i khams  so //
analyzed: gong du gsungs pa'i khams  so //
translated: is the element taught above.

original: de rnams dbus su phul byung che'i //
analyzed: de rnams dbus su phul byung che'i //
translated: In the middle of those,

original: zhes bya gtso bo'i gzugs kyis ni //
analyzed: zhes bya gtso bo'i gzugs kyis ni //
translated: with the form of the principal one called greatly excellent,

original: gsang ba mchog tu dgyes pa na //
analyzed: gsang ba mchog tu dgyes pa na //
translated: in the supreme secret,

original: thams cad bdag nyid rtag tu bzhugs //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid rtag tu bzhugs //
translated: always resides the nature of all.

original: ji lta bur ni bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: ji lta bur ni bcom ldan 'das //
translated: How is it, O Bhagavān,

original: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: that you are united with all buddhas?

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //
translated: The dakinis are bound in the net.

original: gzhan du ji ltar rnam pa 'dis //
analyzed: gzhan du ji ltar rnam pa 'dis //
translated: Otherwise, how is it in this way?

original: sdom pa mchog tu phan pa las //
analyzed: sdom pa mchog tu phan pa las //
translated: From the supreme benefit of the vow,

original: gsang ba'i sgras ni yon tan can //
analyzed: gsang ba'i sgras ni yon tan can //
translated: the secret sound is endowed with qualities.

original: gsang ba'ang yon tan du ni grags //
analyzed: gsang ba'ang yon tan du ni grags //
translated: The secret is also renowned as a quality.

original: rdo rje can ni yon tan can //
analyzed: rdo rje can ni yon tan can //
translated: The vajra holder is endowed with qualities.

original: 'jig rten mchog dgyes smod pa spangs //
analyzed: 'jig rten mchog dgyes smod pa spangs //
translated: The supreme joy of the world is abandoned.

original: gsang ba'i sgra ni kla klo'i skad //
analyzed: gsang ba'i sgra ni kla klo'i skad //
translated: The secret sound is the language of the barbarians.

original: phyi rol rjes su btsal bas kyang //
analyzed: phyi rol rjes su btsal bas kyang //
translated: Even though one searches externally,

original: 'di ni mngon sum shes par bya //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum shes par bya //
translated: this is known through direct perception.🔽When the mind is not seen

original: rjes dpag yon tan can gyi sgras //🔽gang tshe sems ni mi mthong ste //
analyzed: rjes dpag yon tan can gyi sgras // gang tshe sems ni mi mthong ste //
translated: through the sound of the quality of inference,

original: sems zhes bya ba 'di yang ni //
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba 'di yang ni //
translated: this so-called mind

original: yon tan can dang yon tan gsungs //
analyzed: yon tan can dang yon tan gsungs //
translated: is said to be a quality and a possessor of qualities.

original: gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na //
analyzed: gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na //
translated: In the supreme joy of the secret,

original: thams cad bdag nyid rtag tu bzhugs //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid rtag tu bzhugs //
translated: everything always exists.🔽The dharmatā of everything

original: gsang ba 'di la chos nyid gnas //🔽de la thams cad bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: gsang ba 'di la chos nyid gnas // de la thams cad bdag nyid ni //
translated: resides in this secret.

original: de ni thams cad rnam par gnas //
analyzed: de ni thams cad rnam par gnas //
translated: Everything exists in that.

original: de gang stong pa'i rdo rje can //
analyzed: de gang stong pa'i rdo rje can //
translated: That is the empty vajra holder.

original: sdug dang lhan cig dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sdug dang lhan cig dga' ba'o //
translated: It is the joy with the beloved.

original: gang tshe sems kyi gzugs kyis ni //
analyzed: gang tshe sems kyi gzugs kyis ni //
translated: When the form of the mind

original: sngo sogs mig gis mi mthong zhing //🔽sgra sogs thos par @483a *//
analyzed: sngo sogs mig gis mi mthong zhing // sgra sogs thos par @483a *//
translated: is not seen by the eye, such as blue and so forth,

original: mi 'gyur ba //🔽de che sems ni ji lta bur //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba // de che sems ni ji lta bur //
translated: and sound and so forth are not heard,🔽then how is the mind at that time?

original: de tshe rjes dpag ji ltar lags //
analyzed: de tshe rjes dpag ji ltar lags //
translated: How is it an inference then?

original: 'di ni sna yis mi dmigs na //
analyzed: 'di ni sna yis mi dmigs na //
translated: When the nose does not apprehend this,🔽does a good smell exist in the middle?

original: dri bzang dbus su gnas sam ci; ;sems ni phyi rol mi dmigs shing //
analyzed: dri bzang dbus su gnas sam ci; ;sems ni phyi rol mi dmigs shing //
translated: The mind does not apprehend the external,

original: de bzhin nye ba'i longs spyod med //
analyzed: de bzhin nye ba'i longs spyod med //
translated: and likewise, there is no enjoyment.

original: ro ni mngar dang kha la min //
analyzed: ro ni mngar dang kha la min //
translated: Sweet taste is not in the mouth,

original: de bzhin du ni reg bya nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni reg bya nyid //
translated: and likewise, there is no tactile sensation.

original: gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na //
analyzed: gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na //
translated: In the supreme secret joy,

original: thams cad bdag nyid rtag tu bzhugs //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid rtag tu bzhugs //
translated: all are always present.

original: gsang ba 'di ni ji lta bur //
analyzed: gsang ba 'di ni ji lta bur //
translated: How is this secret

original: rjes su dpag pas bsam par bya //🔽ji ltar yi ge'i dbyibs su ni //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas bsam par bya // ji ltar yi ge'i dbyibs su ni //
translated: to be contemplated with inference?🔽How is the wisdom

original: phyin pa yi ni ye shes nyid //
analyzed: phyin pa yi ni ye shes nyid //
translated: that has gone to the shape of the letters?

original: gzhan du bcom ldan sgra ji ltar //
analyzed: gzhan du bcom ldan sgra ji ltar //
translated: How is the Bhagavān sound elsewhere?

original: lha zhes bya ba ji ltar lags //
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba ji ltar lags //
translated: How is it called a deity?

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi nges don ci //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi nges don ci //
translated: What is the definitive meaning of all buddhas?

original: mnyam par sbyor ba ci zhes bgyi //
analyzed: mnyam par sbyor ba ci zhes bgyi //
translated: What is called union?

original: mkha' 'gro ma ni gang gi ming //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma ni gang gi ming //
translated: What is the name of the ḍākinī?

original: dra ba ji lta bu zhig lags //
analyzed: dra ba ji lta bu zhig lags //
translated: What is the nature of the net?

original: sdom pa zhes bya ci zhig bshad //
analyzed: sdom pa zhes bya ci zhig bshad //
translated: What is explained as the vow?

original: de bzhin spyad par dka' ba nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin spyad par dka' ba nyid //
translated: And likewise, what is difficult to practice?

original: khyod kyis 'dod chags med gsungs ci //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'dod chags med gsungs ci //
translated: What is said to be non-attachment?

original: chags bral med pa de bzhin gzhan //
analyzed: chags bral med pa de bzhin gzhan //
translated: And what is the other, non-separation from attachment?

original: dbu ma zhes bya gang gi ming //
analyzed: dbu ma zhes bya gang gi ming //
translated: What is the name of the middle way?

original: bud med kun gyi sgyu ma ci //🔽stong nyid gzugs khams la sogs pa //
analyzed: bud med kun gyi sgyu ma ci // stong nyid gzugs khams la sogs pa //
translated: What is the illusion of all women?🔽What is explained as the form realm and so forth?

original: ci zhig bshad cing mnyam nyid sbyor //
analyzed: ci zhig bshad cing mnyam nyid sbyor //
translated: What is the union of emptiness?🔽The first is sixfold:

original: dang po rnam pa drug 'gyur dang // sna tshogs padmar bris sku dang // a'a li k'a li phyag rgya che //
analyzed: dang po rnam pa drug 'gyur dang // sna tshogs padmar bris sku dang // a'a li k'a li phyag rgya che //
translated: The painted form, the great mudrā of the vowels and consonants,🔽The yoga of the mind without reality,

original: de nyid med sems rnal 'byor dang // de nyid bzang po ji ltar lags //
analyzed: de nyid med sems rnal 'byor dang // de nyid bzang po ji ltar lags //
translated: And how is it the good reality?🔽The yoga itself is equipoise,

original: rnal 'byor nyid la mnyam gzhag dang // phyi rol dag kyang yang dag bshad //
analyzed: rnal 'byor nyid la mnyam gzhag dang // phyi rol dag kyang yang dag bshad //
translated: And the external is also explained.

original: zla @483b ba nyi ma rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: zla @483b ba nyi ma rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: The moon, sun, and perfect buddha,

original: 'byung ba ji lta bu zhig lags //
analyzed: 'byung ba ji lta bu zhig lags //
translated: What is the nature of the elements?

original: bris pa dang ni ma bris pa'i //
analyzed: bris pa dang ni ma bris pa'i //
translated: The written and the unwritten,

original: dkyil 'khor ji ltar bzhag par ba gyi //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ji ltar bzhag par ba gyi //
translated: And how the maṇḍala is arranged.🔽Likewise, the mantras and the tantras themselves,

original: de bzhin sngags dang rgyud nyid dang // gsang ba'i gnas ni mi 'tshal zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin sngags dang rgyud nyid dang // gsang ba'i gnas ni mi 'tshal zhing //
translated: And the secret places are not known,

original: padma bzhin ni khyad par du //
analyzed: padma bzhin ni khyad par du //
translated: And like a lotus, in particular,

original: bdag dang bdag gi ji ltar lags //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ji ltar lags //
translated: How is it for me and mine?

original: de bzhin sems dang sems byung nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin sems dang sems byung nyid //
translated: Likewise, the mind and mental factors,

original: sems kyi ngo bo ye shes gsungs //
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo ye shes gsungs //
translated: The essence of the mind is said to be wisdom.

original: de bzhin rnam par shes pa nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin rnam par shes pa nyid //
translated: Likewise, consciousness itself,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang // de bzhin chos dang chos can nyid //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang // de bzhin chos dang chos can nyid //
translated: The state of cause and effect, and likewise, the dharma and the dharmin,

original: chu bo'i rgyun ni ci zhes bshad //
analyzed: chu bo'i rgyun ni ci zhes bshad //
translated: What is said to be the continuous flow of the river?

original: rgya mtsho yang ni khyad par du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho yang ni khyad par du'o //
translated: And the ocean, in particular.

original: sna tshogs nyid ni khyod gsungs na //
analyzed: sna tshogs nyid ni khyod gsungs na //
translated: You have taught the diversity itself,

original: mang po ji ltar 'thob mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mang po ji ltar 'thob mi 'gyur //
translated: But how can the many not be obtained?

original: rnam shes ye shes khyod kyis gsungs //
analyzed: rnam shes ye shes khyod kyis gsungs //
translated: You have taught consciousness and wisdom,

original: de bzhin bcud kyi len nyid dang // g-yon brkyang la sogs ci lags dang // gzhu yis rnam rgyal de bzhin gzhan //
analyzed: de bzhin bcud kyi len nyid dang // g-yon brkyang la sogs ci lags dang // gzhu yis rnam rgyal de bzhin gzhan //
translated: Likewise, the alchemical extraction of essence, and what is the left-extended [mudrā], and so forth, and the victory with the bow, and likewise the other,

original: gco dang gtso min sgra ci lags //
analyzed: gco dang gtso min sgra ci lags //
translated: And what is the sound of the non-chief and the chief?

original: brtag pa yang ni ci zhig gsungs //
analyzed: brtag pa yang ni ci zhig gsungs //
translated: And what is the examination?

original: byang chub chen po'i chos rnams ni //
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i chos rnams ni //
translated: The dharmas of great awakening🔽Are the thirty-seven factors, and likewise others,

original: sum cu rtsa bdun nang gi dang // sku la sogs pa de bzhin gzhan //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa bdun nang gi dang // sku la sogs pa de bzhin gzhan //
translated: The body, and so on.🔽What is the purpose of the śrāvakas’

original: nyan thos rnams kyis khyod gsungs dang // des kyang dgos pa ci zhig mchis //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis khyod gsungs dang // des kyang dgos pa ci zhig mchis //
translated: Teaching of you?🔽What is the purpose of the form

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bde ba che'i //🔽rnam pa'i rnal 'byor gyis ni ci; ;tshangs pa dbang phyug khyab 'jug kyang //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bde ba che'i // rnam pa'i rnal 'byor gyis ni ci; ;tshangs pa dbang phyug khyab 'jug kyang //
translated: Of Vajrasattva, the great bliss?

original: de bzhin gsol ba ci yi don //
analyzed: de bzhin gsol ba ci yi don //
translated: What is the purpose of the prayer🔽To Brahmā, Īśvara, and Viṣṇu?🔽What is the purpose of the desire

original: 'dod pa'i lha ni chung mar bcas //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha ni chung mar bcas //
translated: For the gods and their wives?🔽What is the purpose of the form

original: lha mo dka' bzlog gzugs bzang ma //
analyzed: lha mo dka' bzlog gzugs bzang ma //
translated: Of the goddess Durga?🔽What is the purpose of the union

original: gong du skyabs su song @484a *//🔽ba nyid // gnyis gnyis sbyor ba 'dod mdzad pa //
analyzed: gong du skyabs su song @484a *// ba nyid // gnyis gnyis sbyor ba 'dod mdzad pa //
translated: Of the one who has gone for refuge?🔽What is the purpose of the battle🔽Of the union of the two?

original: 'di ltar sbyor ba'i 'thab mo dang // de la gsang ba ji lta bu //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyor ba'i 'thab mo dang // de la gsang ba ji lta bu //
translated: What is the secret in that?

original: rdo rje can gyis rdzun pa yi //
analyzed: rdo rje can gyis rdzun pa yi //
translated: The vajra holder speaks

original: phyis ni tshig tu smra bar mdzad //
analyzed: phyis ni tshig tu smra bar mdzad //
translated: Later with false words.

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje sems dpa' yang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje sems dpa' yang //
translated: Even the Buddha, Vajrasattva,

original: tshangs pa khyab 'jug dbang phyug dang // zla ba sngar gsungs gzhan du ni //
analyzed: tshangs pa khyab 'jug dbang phyug dang // zla ba sngar gsungs gzhan du ni //
translated: the moon, and others mentioned before,

original: thams cad bdag nyid rtag tu bzhugs //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid rtag tu bzhugs //
translated: all exist in the nature of the self.

original: 'di ltar rdo rje can zhi bas //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdo rje can zhi bas //
translated: In this way, O Vajra, you are peaceful,

original: khro bo'i gzugs can ji ltar lags //
analyzed: khro bo'i gzugs can ji ltar lags //
translated: but how can you have a wrathful form?

original: chos kyi sku ni ji ltar lags //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni ji ltar lags //
translated: How is it that you have the dharmakāya,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa ci zhig lags //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa ci zhig lags //
translated: and how is it that you have the saṃbhogakāya?

original: sprul pa rdo rje nyid 'byung dang // he ru ka ni ji ltar gsungs //
analyzed: sprul pa rdo rje nyid 'byung dang // he ru ka ni ji ltar gsungs //
translated: How is it that you are the arising of the vajra itself, and how is it that you are proclaimed as Heruka?

original: padma gar dbang ji ltar lags //
analyzed: padma gar dbang ji ltar lags //
translated: How is it that you are Padmanartṛīśvara,

original: gshin rje yi ni gzugs su 'gyur //
analyzed: gshin rje yi ni gzugs su 'gyur //
translated: and how is it that you have the form of Yamarāja?

original: de bzhin du ni rta mchog nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni rta mchog nyid //
translated: In the same way, how is it that you are Hayagrīva?

original: ji ltar cho gas ci gsungs dang // lha mo de bzhin khro bo nyid //
analyzed: ji ltar cho gas ci gsungs dang // lha mo de bzhin khro bo nyid //
translated: How is it that you are the wrathful ones, the goddesses, and what has been taught through the rites?

original: kla klo khyod kyis bshad pa ni //
analyzed: kla klo khyod kyis bshad pa ni //
translated: You have explained the barbarian language,

original: des kyang dgos pa ci zhig mchis //
analyzed: des kyang dgos pa ci zhig mchis //
translated: but what is the purpose of that?

original: re zhig lha mo rnams kyi tshig /
analyzed: re zhig lha mo rnams kyi tshig /
translated: First, how is it that the words of the goddesses

original: btu bar byas pa ji ltar lags //
analyzed: btu bar byas pa ji ltar lags //
translated: are to be compiled?

original: sngags kyi smra 'os 'di dag ni //
analyzed: sngags kyi smra 'os 'di dag ni //
translated: These are worthy of being spoken by the mantra,

original: ji ltar rdo rje sems khyod kyis //
analyzed: ji ltar rdo rje sems khyod kyis //
translated: O Vajrasattva,

original: thams cad yang dag rnam par shod //
analyzed: thams cad yang dag rnam par shod //
translated: All of them are to be spoken of as perfected.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa //
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas bzung ste dang por brtsam par byas nas 'dir yang rjes su 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas bzung ste dang por brtsam par byas nas 'dir yang rjes su 'byung ste /
translated: From Thus have I heard up to first composed, it occurs here as well.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: it should be spoken of again.

original: gsang ba'i sgras ni bdun gyi rnam pa ste @484b bdun pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsang ba'i sgras ni bdun gyi rnam pa ste @484b bdun pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By the word secret, the seven aspects are meant, with the meaning of seventh.

original: brgyad pa ni brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The eighth is the characteristic of the inexpressible.

original: gsang ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems dang / sems las byung ba gnyis su med pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems dang / sems las byung ba gnyis su med pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: By the word secret, the non-duality of mind and mental factors is taught as the Tathāgata himself.

original: de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa nyid ngo bo gcig pas der gsang bar byung ba'i phyir gsang ba ste nam mkha' thams cad du khyab par 'gro ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi tshad de dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa dang
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa nyid ngo bo gcig pas der gsang bar byung ba'i phyir gsang ba ste nam mkha' thams cad du khyab par 'gro ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi tshad de dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa dang
translated: Since it is of one taste in suchness, it is of one nature. Because it arises there as secret, it is secret. The extent of the Blessed One, pervading all space, is the wisdom consort of glorious Vajrasattva and so forth.🔽

original: // rdo rje'i lha mo dang ldan pa ni gnas so //🔽kye; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: // rdo rje'i lha mo dang ldan pa ni gnas so // kye; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The place is the abode of the Vajra Goddesses.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas gang lags //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas gang lags //
translated: Lord, what is the special place?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽mchog ces bya ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / mchog ces bya ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
translated: The Lord said:

original: ye shes dam pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: ye shes dam pa'i yul lo //
translated: The supreme is the special, the object of the highest intuition.

original: dgyes pa na zhes bya ba ni nyams dga' ba na ste dpe thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dgyes pa na zhes bya ba ni nyams dga' ba na ste dpe thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: The place of joy is the place of delight, free from all examples.

original: spyan la sogs pa dang yang dag par sbyor bas dga' bar byed pas nyams dga' bar byed pa'i phyir dgyes pa na'o //
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa dang yang dag par sbyor bas dga' bar byed pas nyams dga' bar byed pa'i phyir dgyes pa na'o //
translated: It is the place of joy because it delights by the union with Locana and so on.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba dang / lha mo thams cad dang mnyam par 'gro bas nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs par lha mo thams cad kyi bde ba chen por sbyor ba thams cad kyi bde ba dang ldan pa 'di las byung ba'i stobs ni gzhal du med pa sta phan tshun du rab tu
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba dang / lha mo thams cad dang mnyam par 'gro bas nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs par lha mo thams cad kyi bde ba chen por sbyor ba thams cad kyi bde ba dang ldan pa 'di las byung ba'i stobs ni gzhal du med pa sta phan tshun du rab tu
translated: The power is the immeasurable power of the union with all goddesses, which arises from this union with the great bliss of all goddesses, extending to the limits of space, by the union with all goddesses and by the union with Sri Vajrasattva and all goddesses.

original: rangs las dga' bar byed cing skyes bu rnams dang de rnams kyi dga' ba ni @485a *//
analyzed: rangs las dga' bar byed cing skyes bu rnams dang de rnams kyi dga' ba ni @485a *//
translated: The joy of the beings and their joy is

original: dgyes pa na'o //
analyzed: dgyes pa na'o //
translated: the delight.

original: thams cad bdag nyid ces bya ba ni thams cad kyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ces bya ba ni thams cad kyi bdag nyid de /
translated: The nature of all is the nature of all.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas gang sngar gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas gang sngar gsungs pa'o //
translated: thus the Blessed One has previously taught the place.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he is said to be the nature of all the Tathāgatas.

original: thams cad bdag nyid kyis ni de dag gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid kyis ni de dag gsungs so //
translated: He is taught to be the nature of all.

original: de ltar gyur pas thams cad bdag nyid ces bya ba 'dis gnas phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pas thams cad bdag nyid ces bya ba 'dis gnas phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In this way, by saying the nature of all, he teaches the perfection of the place.

original: ji ltar gsungs pa'i gnas su so so bskyed pa'i rang bzhin gyis ji snyed btsun mo'i 'khor gyi dbus su rtag tu bzhugs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs pa'i gnas su so so bskyed pa'i rang bzhin gyis ji snyed btsun mo'i 'khor gyi dbus su rtag tu bzhugs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the place that is taught, he always resides in the midst of the retinue of consorts, by the nature of being generated individually.

original: sangs rgyas dang kun 'di ni sangs rgyas kun te 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang kun 'di ni sangs rgyas kun te 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: The buddhas and all are all the buddhas, equal to the atoms in all world systems.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byas pa'i phyir ram //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byas pa'i phyir ram //
translated: because of the permanence, etc., of the Tathāgatas, or

original: rang bzhin gyi phyir gnas ni sangs rgyas kun dngos zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi phyir gnas ni sangs rgyas kun dngos zhes bya ba ste /
translated: because of their intrinsic reality, the abode is called “the actuality of all the buddhas.”

original: rgyu'am / rang bzhin la dngos po'o //
analyzed: rgyu'am / rang bzhin la dngos po'o //
translated: The actuality is in the cause or in the intrinsic reality.

original: sems dpa' ni sems can gyi don la nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni sems can gyi don la nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The “hero” is so called because of his ability to benefit sentient beings.

original: rdo rje ni thabs dang / shes rab kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje ni thabs dang / shes rab kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: The “vajra” is so called because of the intrinsic reality of the intuition of the means and insight.

original: sems dpa' ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis mi bskyod pa'i phyir ro //🔽bde ba ni sngar gsungs pa'i dga' ba'i sbyor ba las shin tu ldan par zhi ba'i yid kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis mi bskyod pa'i phyir ro // bde ba ni sngar gsungs pa'i dga' ba'i sbyor ba las shin tu ldan par zhi ba'i yid kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: The “hero” is so called because he is unshaken by any conceptualization.🔽The “bliss” is so called because of the intrinsic nature of the mind which is endowed with the highest peace through the practice of the joy previously described.

original: mchog ni khyad par du @485b 'phags pa ste bde ba'i go 'phang 'di rnams kyi sems dpa' 'di rnams kyi don dam pa'i phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mchog ni khyad par du @485b 'phags pa ste bde ba'i go 'phang 'di rnams kyi sems dpa' 'di rnams kyi don dam pa'i phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The “supreme” is so called because of the excellence of the bliss. The actuality of these heroes is said to be the ultimate perfection of these heroes.

original: 'on kyang / sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor ba; ;mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba'i sdom //
analyzed: 'on kyang / sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor ba; ;mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba'i sdom //
translated: However, it is not accepted that

original: zhes bya ba mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the union with all buddhas is the binding of the dakinis' network.

original: 'on kyang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, Then what should be said about the other?

original: dogs pa bsu nas bka' stsal pa /🔽'di ni zhes bya ba ni gang de skad du rigs kyi bu de ni gsungs pa de nyid sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor ba /
analyzed: dogs pa bsu nas bka' stsal pa / 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gang de skad du rigs kyi bu de ni gsungs pa de nyid sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor ba /
translated: anticipating that question, it is said:🔽This refers to the one who is called son of a good family.

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba'i sdom pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba'i sdom pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the union with all buddhas and the binding of the dakinis' network is explained.

original: lha mo thams cad kyis yongs su bskor cing dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor rdzogs pa ni skal ba bzang ba ste /
analyzed: lha mo thams cad kyis yongs su bskor cing dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor rdzogs pa ni skal ba bzang ba ste /
translated: The one who is surrounded by all goddesses and who has perfected the yoga of the nature of glorious Vajrasattva is fortunate.

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa shin tu sbyor ba de nyid mchog tu 'dod chags pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa shin tu sbyor ba de nyid mchog tu 'dod chags pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: That very practice of one's own union is the one who possesses supreme passion.

original: skyes bu med pa'i gar mkhan rang gi btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du gnas pa'i shin tu don la rnam par mi g-yeng bas lha mo rnams dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i bde ba myang bar bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu med pa'i gar mkhan rang gi btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du gnas pa'i shin tu don la rnam par mi g-yeng bas lha mo rnams dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i bde ba myang bar bya'o //
translated: The man, who is without a body, should experience the bliss of union with the goddesses, remaining in the midst of his retinue of queens, completely undistracted from the ultimate.

original: yang dag par sbyor ba ni rnal 'byor te zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba ni rnal 'byor te zhes pa'o //
translated: Union is yoga.

original: brtan pa / rtag pa /
analyzed: brtan pa / rtag pa /
translated: Firm,🔽and

original: mchog tu yang /
analyzed: mchog tu yang /
translated: supremely

original: yid srub pa'o //
analyzed: yid srub pa'o //
translated: pleasing.

original: yang na brtan pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gis mi g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na brtan pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gis mi g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, firm means not moving due to the winds of conceptuality.

original: gzhan yang / mtha'i mtha' ji srid gnas pa'i phyir rtag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / mtha'i mtha' ji srid gnas pa'i phyir rtag pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is permanent because it remains for as long as the end of the end.

original: mchog tu nyid srub pa ni lha mo thams cad kyi bde ba rjes su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu nyid srub pa ni lha mo thams cad kyi bde ba rjes su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Supremely pleasing means experiencing the bliss of all goddesses.🔽Firm,

original: brtan pa @486a *//
analyzed: brtan pa @486a *//
translated: permanent,

original: dang; rtag pa dang / mchog tu yid srub pa 'di ni brtan pa dang / rtag pa dang / mchog tu yid srub pa'o //
analyzed: dang; rtag pa dang / mchog tu yid srub pa 'di ni brtan pa dang / rtag pa dang / mchog tu yid srub pa'o //
translated: and supremely pleasing is firm, permanent, and supremely pleasing.

original: sangs rgyas kun zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang; sgra dang; dri dang / ro dang / reg bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang; sgra dang; dri dang / ro dang / reg bya ste /
translated: “All buddhas” refers to form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.🔽

original: yul gyi rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: yul gyi rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: The all buddhas are the natures of form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: rang gi bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyu mthun pas ci zhig byed cen /
analyzed: rang gi bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyu mthun pas ci zhig byed cen /
translated: What does one do with the natural outflow of one's own merit?

original: 'di ni rang gi longs spyod dang de rnams za bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi longs spyod dang de rnams za bar byed do //
translated: One enjoys one's own wealth and those [objects].

original: gzhan du na ni tha dad pa'i dngos po la rang gi nye bar longs spyod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni tha dad pa'i dngos po la rang gi nye bar longs spyod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, one does not enjoy one's own [wealth] in separate things.

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin so sor skyes pa ni rgyal ba rnams kyis kyang shin tu mi spong ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin so sor skyes pa ni rgyal ba rnams kyis kyang shin tu mi spong ste /
translated: The individual arising of the nature of wisdom is not abandoned even by the victors.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rim pa'i sbyong pa'i 'dod chags kyi spyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las gang zhig 'dod chags la spyod pa de rnams rdo rje sems dpa'i cho ga 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rim pa'i sbyong pa'i 'dod chags kyi spyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las gang zhig 'dod chags la spyod pa de rnams rdo rje sems dpa'i cho ga 'dod pa'o //
translated: Those who engage in desire, etc., through the stages of various aspects, from the nature of desire, etc., desire the rite of Vajrasattva.

original: gang zhig rang bzhin bzang po de rnams ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dngos grub 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rang bzhin bzang po de rnams ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dngos grub 'dod pa'o //
translated: Those who are naturally good desire the power of Vairocana.

original: de ltar zhe sdang dang / 'dod chags dang / ser sna dang / le lo la spyod pa rnams kyis he ru ka dang / padma gar gyi dbang phyug dang / rdo rje nyi ma dang / rta mchog gi cho ga 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhe sdang dang / 'dod chags dang / ser sna dang / le lo la spyod pa rnams kyis he ru ka dang / padma gar gyi dbang phyug dang / rdo rje nyi ma dang / rta mchog gi cho ga 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, those who practice with hatred, desire, greed, and laziness will desire the rites of Heruka, Padmanarteśvara, Vajrasūrya, and Hayakṛta.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family!

original: de lta da ltar 'dod chags la spyod pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis ji ltar dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bskyed par 'gyur ba de bskyed nas tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor rnal 'byor @486b las bskyed de rnal 'byor gyi gtam gyis slob ma
analyzed: de lta da ltar 'dod chags la spyod pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis ji ltar dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bskyed par 'gyur ba de bskyed nas tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor rnal 'byor @486b las bskyed de rnal 'byor gyi gtam gyis slob ma
translated: Thus, those who practice with desire and so forth, by means of the discordant side, will generate the glorious Vajrasattva and so forth. Having generated that, they will generate the mandala of the assembly from the yoga. With the discourse of yoga, they will

original: 'dul bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dul bar byed do //
translated: tame the disciples.

original: gtam ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gtam ni brjod pa'o //
translated: Discourse is speech.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: gtam ji lta bu lags //
analyzed: gtam ji lta bu lags //
translated: What kind of discourse is it?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: gsang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtam brjod pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtam brjod pa ste /
translated: The discourse called “Secret” and so forth is spoken.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin du byas pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin du byas pa'o //
translated: It is made into the nature of conventional truth.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i chos kyi sku'i rgyu mthun pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i rang bzhin la nye bar spyod pa'i phyir dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i chos kyi sku'i rgyu mthun pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i rang bzhin la nye bar spyod pa'i phyir dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: The splendid is the nature of the essential body, which is the cause of the Dharma body of the glorious Vajrasattva.🔽The firm is the Dharma, which is firm like Mount Meru.

original: rang bzhin brjod par bya ste brtan pa zhes bya ba ni chos ri rab ltar brtan pa'o; ;dper na /
analyzed: rang bzhin brjod par bya ste brtan pa zhes bya ba ni chos ri rab ltar brtan pa'o; ;dper na /
translated: For example,

original: ri rab rlung gis bzlog pa dka' zhing rab tu gtum pas kyang bskyod par mi nus so //
analyzed: ri rab rlung gis bzlog pa dka' zhing rab tu gtum pas kyang bskyod par mi nus so //
translated: Mount Meru is difficult to move by the wind, and cannot be shaken by a very strong wind.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: the Blessed One,

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' 'di ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / mu stegs can ngan pa'i rgol ba rab tu gtum zhing rab tu 'joms pas rang lhag par 'gro zhing bskyod par mi nus so //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' 'di ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / mu stegs can ngan pa'i rgol ba rab tu gtum zhing rab tu 'joms pas rang lhag par 'gro zhing bskyod par mi nus so //
translated: the glorious Vajrasattva, cannot be moved by the very strong and very powerful afflictions such as desire, the secondary afflictions, and the evil tīrthika opponents.

original: dur khrod du bzhugs pas kyang sems can thams cad kyi rgyud du rgyu zhing rnam par dag pa'i sems chos kyi sgo du mar rjes su 'khor zhing /
analyzed: dur khrod du bzhugs pas kyang sems can thams cad kyi rgyud du rgyu zhing rnam par dag pa'i sems chos kyi sgo du mar rjes su 'khor zhing /
translated: And by dwelling in the charnel grounds, he is the one who moves through the mindstreams of all sentient beings, and who, in the form of the pure mind, moves through the many doors of the Dharma.

original: lhan cag tu bcom ldan 'das 'khor bar bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cag tu bcom ldan 'das 'khor bar bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He is the one who dwells in the mindstreams of all sentient beings.

original: brtan pa zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: brtan pa zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i phyogs so //
translated: “ Steadfast” refers to the side of stability.

original: g-yo ba zhes bya ba 'di ni sems can gyi rgyud las gzung ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba zhes bya ba 'di ni sems can gyi rgyud las gzung ste /
translated: “ Moving” refers to the side of the mindstreams of sentient beings.

original: de rnams ni bcom ldan @487a *//🔽'das kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni bcom ldan @487a *// 'das kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One knows those.

original: ji ltar rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid de rnams nyid de gzhan dang rnam pa gcig pa'i ngo bos ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid de rnams nyid de gzhan dang rnam pa gcig pa'i ngo bos ste /
translated: How so? He knows them as having the nature of purity, as being the same in terms of their essence,

original: de bzhin nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das /
translated: because of suchness.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs rnams la bzhugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs rnams la bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One dwells in the minds of all tathāgatas.

original: sems can nyid kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
analyzed: sems can nyid kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
translated: Sentient beings are also all tathāgatas.

original: dngos po'i don dam pa la gnas pas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dngos po'i don dam pa la gnas pas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because they abide in the ultimate reality, they are called tathāgatas.

original: g-yo ba ni spre'u ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba ni spre'u ste /
translated: “ Moving” refers to the monkey.

original: gang zhig sems can thams cad kyi sems brtan pa'i phyir sems dpa' zhes gsungs so; ;'dzin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: gang zhig sems can thams cad kyi sems brtan pa'i phyir sems dpa' zhes gsungs so; ;'dzin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: It is called “concentration” because it holds.

original: nges par 'byed pas rdo rje nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pas rdo rje nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is called “vajra” because it penetrates.

original: de'i phyir sems kho na g-yo ba nyid du gsungs shing phyi rol la sogs pas ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kho na g-yo ba nyid du gsungs shing phyi rol la sogs pas ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, only the mind is said to be mobile, not external objects, etc.

original: de rnams ni gcig dang du mas dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni gcig dang du mas dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are neither one nor many.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni ma lus pa'o //
translated: “All” means “without exception.”

original: dngos po zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi don to //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi don to //
translated: “Things” means “abodes.”

original: srid pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: “Existence” means “birth.”

original: brtan pa dang / g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: brtan pa dang / g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'o //
translated: “Mobile and immobile” means “mobile and immobile.”

original: dngos po dang thams cad 'di ni dngos po thams cad de /
analyzed: dngos po dang thams cad 'di ni dngos po thams cad de /
translated: “All things” means “all things.”

original: de ni brtan pa dang / g-yo ba dang / g-yo ba thams cad dngos po dang / srid pa'o //
analyzed: de ni brtan pa dang / g-yo ba dang / g-yo ba thams cad dngos po dang / srid pa'o //
translated: That is, mobile and immobile, all mobile things, and existence.

original: brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni gang gi thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin 'di ni brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i dngos @487b po thams cad kyi bdag nyid can de /
analyzed: brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni gang gi thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin 'di ni brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i dngos @487b po thams cad kyi bdag nyid can de /
translated: The nature of all things, moving and unmoving, is the nature of all things, moving and unmoving, which is the nature of all things, moving and unmoving.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can gyis rdo rje 'di bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can gyis rdo rje 'di bka' stsal to //
translated: Therefore, this vajra was spoken by the Blessed One, the Vajra Holder.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i thugs kyi chos nyid kyis brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i thugs kyi chos nyid kyis brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid de /
translated: By the reality of the mind of Vajrasattva, the nature of all things, moving and unmoving,

original: 'di dag brjod par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu la sogs pas bsdus par 'gyur ba rtag pa dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas lnga po thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs pa bsdus par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag brjod par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu la sogs pas bsdus par 'gyur ba rtag pa dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas lnga po thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs pa bsdus par gyur pa'o //
translated: is included in the pure dharmadhātu, which will be expressed, and in the mirror-like [wisdom] and so forth, and is included in the perfection of all five buddhas, such as Akṣobhya.

original: kun gyi sgras ni yongs su zhes bya bar bzung ngo //
analyzed: kun gyi sgras ni yongs su zhes bya bar bzung ngo //
translated: The word all refers to completely.

original: mnyam par sbyor ba ni 'du ba'o //
analyzed: mnyam par sbyor ba ni 'du ba'o //
translated: Union means coming together.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: gsang bar te /
analyzed: gsang bar te /
translated: In the secret place.

original: thams cad kyi chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi bdag nyid du yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi bdag nyid du yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the nature of the source of all things, not anything else.

original: gang dang lhan cig ce na /
analyzed: gang dang lhan cig ce na /
translated: With what?

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' dang ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' dang ste /
translated: With the Blessed One Vajrasattva.

original: de dang yang dag pa'i rang gi ngo bos sprul pa la sogs pa'i yan lag dgu yis so //
analyzed: de dang yang dag pa'i rang gi ngo bos sprul pa la sogs pa'i yan lag dgu yis so //
translated: And with the nine limbs of union, emanation, etc., in the nature of reality.

original: 'on kyang longs spyod rdzogs pa can du mdzad pa'i sku gcig gis thams cad nas de'i bdag nyid kyi chu dang / 'o ma lta bur 'ong ba yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'on kyang longs spyod rdzogs pa can du mdzad pa'i sku gcig gis thams cad nas de'i bdag nyid kyi chu dang / 'o ma lta bur 'ong ba yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: However, by means of a single body endowed with the perfect rapture of the Dharma, he embraces all things, which are of the nature of that body, like water and milk.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor chen po'i rnal 'byor gyis phyi dang / nang gi dngos po thams cad kyi nang du de kho na skad cig gis ji ltar sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mdzad pa ltar rtogs shing shes so //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor chen po'i rnal 'byor gyis phyi dang / nang gi dngos po thams cad kyi nang du de kho na skad cig gis ji ltar sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mdzad pa ltar rtogs shing shes so //
translated: Then, by means of the yoga of the great mandala, he realizes and understands that reality in an instant, just as all the Buddhas have done, within all things, both internal and external.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas thams cad dang / de las @488a *//
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas thams cad dang / de las @488a *//
translated: Therefore, he is the one who has the nature of all the Buddhas, and he is the one who has the nature of all the mandalas.

original: gzhan pa rnams kyi lhan cig yang dag par sbyor ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan pa rnams kyi lhan cig yang dag par sbyor ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The “union with all the others” is the union with all the Buddhas.

original: mnyam pa'i dus ni dbyer med pa'i dus te /
analyzed: mnyam pa'i dus ni dbyer med pa'i dus te /
translated: The “time of equality” is the time of non-duality.

original: sbyor ba'i gnas kyis thams cad kyis des sems tsam du snyoms par zhugs pas gcig tu gyur pa'i dngos pos phan tshun du bsdus pas dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyis thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba zhes gsungs
analyzed: sbyor ba'i gnas kyis thams cad kyis des sems tsam du snyoms par zhugs pas gcig tu gyur pa'i dngos pos phan tshun du bsdus pas dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyis thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba zhes gsungs
translated: The “place of union” is the place where all enter into the sameness of mind-only, and become one entity, mutually inclusive, and so it is said that they “are united with all the Buddhas” because they have the nature of all things and go everywhere.

original: so // de bas na sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor bas ni phyogs bcu'i nam mkhar 'gro ba yang dag par mthong ba 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba'i mkha' 'gro mar gsungs so //
analyzed: so // de bas na sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor bas ni phyogs bcu'i nam mkhar 'gro ba yang dag par mthong ba 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba'i mkha' 'gro mar gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the “union with all the Buddhas” is the vision of the pervasion of the ten directions with space, and this is said to be the “ḍākinī union with all the Buddhas.”

original: dra ba'i sgras kyang sgyu ma'i rnam grangs su blta ste /
analyzed: dra ba'i sgras kyang sgyu ma'i rnam grangs su blta ste /
translated: The word “net” should be understood as a synonym for “illusion.”

original: shing la sogs pa rnams las sgyu ma'i rnam par sprul pa'i glang po che la sogs pa ltar mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las bud med kyis 'dul ba'i sems can mi spang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa rnams las sgyu ma'i rnam par sprul pa'i glang po che la sogs pa ltar mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las bud med kyis 'dul ba'i sems can mi spang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as elephants and so forth emanated from trees and so forth, so too the Tathagatas Akshobhya and so forth emanate women in order not to abandon sentient beings who are to be disciplined by women.

original: dkar mo la sogs pa'i rdo rje lha mo'i gzugs la reg pa'i phyir 'di nyid gyur pas sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba'i sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyis gang zhig zag pa med pa'i bde bas yid zhi ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa mang por 'gyur ro
analyzed: dkar mo la sogs pa'i rdo rje lha mo'i gzugs la reg pa'i phyir 'di nyid gyur pas sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba'i sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyis gang zhig zag pa med pa'i bde bas yid zhi ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa mang por 'gyur ro
translated: By the mere touch of the form of the Vajra Goddesses, such as Lochana and so forth, all the Buddhas are united in union, and by the characteristics of illusion, one becomes many Tathagatas, whose minds are pacified by undefiled bliss.

original: // de nas sdom pa'i sgras brjod par @488b bya ste /
analyzed: // de nas sdom pa'i sgras brjod par @488b bya ste /
translated: Then, the expression of the vow should be stated:

original: sam zhes bya ba ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: sam zhes bya ba ni bde ba'o //
translated: Sam means bliss.

original: bar zhes bya ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bar zhes bya ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Varam means superior.

original: bud med kun ni gong du gsungs so //
analyzed: bud med kun ni gong du gsungs so //
translated: All women are as stated above.

original: sgyu ma'ang ji skad du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'ang ji skad du gsungs pa ste /
translated: Illusion is as stated above.

original: sgyu mas sgyu ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgyu mas sgyu ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the magical creation is the nature of the magical creation.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis grub ste sgrub pa rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis grub ste sgrub pa rdzogs pa'o //
translated: And that is established by nature, the establishment being complete.

original: ji ltar rang gi ngo bo yongs su gyur pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi ngo bo yongs su gyur pa zhe na /
translated: How is there a transformation of one’s own nature?

original: rang rnams dang de rnams kyi gzugs can ni rang gi gzugs can te /
analyzed: rang rnams dang de rnams kyi gzugs can ni rang gi gzugs can te /
translated: One’s own nature is one’s own form.

original: kun gzhi dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / yid dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa de rnams yongs su gyur pa ni rang gi ngo bo yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / yid dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa de rnams yongs su gyur pa ni rang gi ngo bo yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The transformation of the store-consciousness, the afflicted mind, the eye consciousness, etc., up to the body consciousness is the transformation of one’s own nature.

original: bdag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgom pas me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba nan tan gyi rang bzhin la gnas nas ldog par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgom pas me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba nan tan gyi rang bzhin la gnas nas ldog par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one abides in the mirror-like, the equality, the individual-awareness, and the duty-fulfillment cognitions, and one turns away from the objective supports of the meditation on the selflessness concentration.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi ngo bo yongs su gyur pas bud med thams cad kyi sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi dngos grub yin te /🔽de'i phyir rnyed pa kun gyi bde spro bas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi ngo bo yongs su gyur pas bud med thams cad kyi sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi dngos grub yin te / de'i phyir rnyed pa kun gyi bde spro bas /
translated: Since all women are the nature of illusion by the transformation of their own nature, they are the power of illusion.

original: bud med thams cad 'grub par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bud med thams cad 'grub par 'gyur // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, all women are to be accomplished by the joy of all acquisitions.

original: sna tshogs dang / sgyu ma ni sna tshogs sgyu ma ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs dang / sgyu ma ni sna tshogs sgyu ma ste /
translated: The power of illusion is the illusion of variety.

original: kha dog dang / dbyibs sna tshogs pa las lha mo thams cad la sogs pa'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: kha dog dang / dbyibs sna tshogs pa las lha mo thams cad la sogs pa'i gzugs can no //
translated: From the variety of colors and shapes, all goddesses and so forth have form.

original: de'i sna tshogs sgyu ma'i phyag rgya 'di bzung nas blo la bzhag par byas nas 'di skad bka' stsal pa /🔽nam mkha' 'gro ma bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems @489a *//
analyzed: de'i sna tshogs sgyu ma'i phyag rgya 'di bzung nas blo la bzhag par byas nas 'di skad bka' stsal pa / nam mkha' 'gro ma bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems @489a *//
translated: Having taken up this seal of the illusion of variety, having placed it in the mind, he spoke thus.

original: dpa' nyid kyi btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du son pa'i phyogs bcu'i nam mkha' gang zhig 'gro ba 'di ni sgyu ma sna tshogs kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dpa' nyid kyi btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du son pa'i phyogs bcu'i nam mkha' gang zhig 'gro ba 'di ni sgyu ma sna tshogs kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The Bhagavān Vajrasattva, having entered the retinue of his queen, the sky-wanderers, the ten directions of the sky, this world is the meaning of the seal of the illusion of variety.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi bstan bcos kyi nang du rab tu grags pa mi gsal ba'i skad kyis rang gi brdar byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi bstan bcos kyi nang du rab tu grags pa mi gsal ba'i skad kyis rang gi brdar byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “own-symbol” is that which is well known in all the treatises of the mundane and supramundane, but is expressed in an obscure language.

original: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa 'di ni mdor bsdus nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa 'di ni mdor bsdus nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the brief explanation of the dakinis and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir bud med thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rdo rje lha mo'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bud med thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rdo rje lha mo'o //
translated: Because all women are the vajra goddesses of the Blessed One.

original: 'khor bar byed pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad la gnas nas ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor bar byed pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad la gnas nas ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi grub pa'o //
translated: Having abided in the eight aspects of the consciousnesses, such as the alaya consciousness that creates samsara, they are accomplished as the nature of the illusion of the mirror-like, the equality, the individually discerning, and the all-accomplishing primordial wisdoms by the characteristic of reversal.

original: de'i me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i sna tshogs sgyu ma'i rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de'i me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i sna tshogs sgyu ma'i rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: Their mirror-like primordial wisdom and so forth are the various illusion-like natures.

original: de rnams kyi sgyu mas nam mkhar 'gro ba'i bya ba de ni gzugs sna tshogs su gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sgyu mas nam mkhar 'gro ba'i bya ba de ni gzugs sna tshogs su gyur te /
translated: The activity of their magic in the sky is the variety of forms.

original: de'i phyir sna tshogs sgyu ma'i phyag rgya 'di ni mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sna tshogs sgyu ma'i phyag rgya 'di ni mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this seal of the magic of variety should be called a dakini.

original: kla klos de rnams kyi nam mkhar 'gro ma 'ba' zhig gis bya ba ni mkha' 'gro mar brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kla klos de rnams kyi nam mkhar 'gro ma 'ba' zhig gis bya ba ni mkha' 'gro mar brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: The sky-goers are not called dakinis only because of their activity in the sky.

original: 'di skad du /🔽nam mkha' kun tu spyod grub pa //
analyzed: 'di skad du / nam mkha' kun tu spyod grub pa //
translated: It is said:🔽“She is known as a dakini

original: mkhar 'gro ma zhes rab tu grags //
analyzed: mkhar 'gro ma zhes rab tu grags //
translated: because she moves in the sky and is accomplished.”

original: zhes de'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: zhes de'i phyir bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: kun las zhes bya ba ni phyogs @489b bcu'o //
analyzed: kun las zhes bya ba ni phyogs @489b bcu'o //
translated: “Everywhere” means in the ten directions.

original: sna tshogs dang / de'i phyag rgya ni sna tshogs phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs dang / de'i phyag rgya ni sna tshogs phyag rgya ste /
translated: The seal of the variety is the seal of the variety,

original: spyan la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: the seal of Locana and so forth.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi rnal 'byor gyis sems can gyi khams la phyag rgyas 'debs pa'i phyir des na phyag rgya zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi rnal 'byor gyis sems can gyi khams la phyag rgyas 'debs pa'i phyir des na phyag rgya zhes brjod do //
translated: Because the seal is impressed on the realm of sentient beings by the yoga of the reflected image, therefore it is called a seal.

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi rang bzhin nam /
translated: “Variety” means the nature of everything.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' thams cad dang / phyag rgya ni sna tshogs kyi phyag rgya'o //🔽kun las sna tshogs sdom pa yi /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' thams cad dang / phyag rgya ni sna tshogs kyi phyag rgya'o // kun las sna tshogs sdom pa yi /
translated: The splendor is the vajra-being, and the seal is the various seals.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa ste bde ba'i mchog gis nam mkha' kun tu 'gro ba'i ngo bo ni mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa ste bde ba'i mchog gis nam mkha' kun tu 'gro ba'i ngo bo ni mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: The various is of various kinds, and the binding is the supreme bliss, which is the essence of the all-pervading space, the dakini.

original: sangs rgyas skad dbyings zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dpal rnam par snang mdzad la gnas nas mngon par ldog pa'i rgyu rnams ni de'i rang khams rnams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas skad dbyings zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dpal rnam par snang mdzad la gnas nas mngon par ldog pa'i rgyu rnams ni de'i rang khams rnams te /
translated: The realm of the Buddha's speech is the realm of the Buddha Vairochana, and the cause of manifestation is the nature of that realm.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi rang bzhin gyi khams rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi skad kyi dbyings kyi sgras brjod de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi rang bzhin gyi khams rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi skad kyi dbyings kyi sgras brjod de /
translated: The nature of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas is expressed by the term realm of the Buddha's speech.

original: ji ltar dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la gnas na mngon par ldog pa'i rgyu rnams ni de'i rang bzhin gyis khams rnams te /
analyzed: ji ltar dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la gnas na mngon par ldog pa'i rgyu rnams ni de'i rang bzhin gyis khams rnams te /
translated: Just as the cause of manifestation when abiding in the glorious Vajrasattva is the nature of that realm,

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i sgras nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i rang bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i sgras nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i rang bzhin du bstan to //
translated: The term “dakini” indicates the nature of moving through space.

original: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen bdag po dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa'i khams rnams blta bar bya'o //🔽sangs rgyas kun gyi mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems @490a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen bdag po dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa'i khams rnams blta bar bya'o // sangs rgyas kun gyi mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems @490a *//
translated: In the same way, one should view the elements of Vairochana, Akshobhya, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, and Amoghasiddhi.🔽The “dakini of all buddhas” is Bhagavat Vajrasattva, who is surrounded by Lochana and so forth. All those who move through space are dakinis who are of the nature of Vajrasattva.

original: dpa' la spyan la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba'i nam mkha' la 'gro ba thams cad rdo rje sems dpa'i bdag nyid kyi mkha' 'gro ma dang / de skad du dpal he ru ka la dkar mo la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba'i nam mkha' la 'gro ba thams cad he ru ka'i bdag nyid kyi mkha' 'gro ma dang /
analyzed: dpa' la spyan la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba'i nam mkha' la 'gro ba thams cad rdo rje sems dpa'i bdag nyid kyi mkha' 'gro ma dang / de skad du dpal he ru ka la dkar mo la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba'i nam mkha' la 'gro ba thams cad he ru ka'i bdag nyid kyi mkha' 'gro ma dang /
translated: In the same way, the “dakini of all heroes” is Shri Heruka, who is surrounded by white and so forth. All those who move through space are dakinis who are of the nature of Heruka.

original: de skad du bdag med ma'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa la rdo rje ma la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba'i nam mkha' la 'gro ba thams cad bdag med ma'i bdag nyid kyi mkha' 'gro ma dang / de skad du ye shes dang ldan pa la rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba'i nam mkha' la 'gro ba thams cad ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi mkha' 'gro ma dang /
analyzed: de skad du bdag med ma'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa la rdo rje ma la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba'i nam mkha' la 'gro ba thams cad bdag med ma'i bdag nyid kyi mkha' 'gro ma dang / de skad du ye shes dang ldan pa la rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba'i nam mkha' la 'gro ba thams cad ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi mkha' 'gro ma dang /
translated: Thus, in the sky surrounded by Vajraḍāka and so on, all migrating beings are ḍākas and ḍākinīs who are the nature of Nairātmya.🔽Thus, in the sky surrounded by Vajraḍāka and so on, all migrating beings are ḍākas and ḍākinīs who are the nature of Timeless Awareness.🔽Thus, in the sky surrounded by Vajraḍāka and so on, all migrating beings are ḍākas and ḍākinīs who are the nature of the Lotus.

original: de ltar sgrol ma dang lhan cig padma can dang / padma'i 'khor lo dang / gshin rje'i rgyal po dang / de skad du rta mchog dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba nyid dang / gzhan yang yid la 'dod pa'ang rigs kyi rab tu dbye bas phye ba la mkha' 'gro mas de bzhin du yongs su bskor ba nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar sgrol ma dang lhan cig padma can dang / padma'i 'khor lo dang / gshin rje'i rgyal po dang / de skad du rta mchog dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba nyid dang / gzhan yang yid la 'dod pa'ang rigs kyi rab tu dbye bas phye ba la mkha' 'gro mas de bzhin du yongs su bskor ba nyid du brjod do //
translated: Thus, in the sky surrounded by Vajraḍāka and so on, all migrating beings are ḍākas and ḍākinīs who are the nature of the Wheel.🔽Thus, in the sky surrounded by Vajraḍāka and so on, all migrating beings are ḍākas and ḍākinīs who are the nature of the Lord of Death.🔽Thus, in the sky surrounded by Vajraḍāka and so on, all migrating beings are ḍākas and ḍākinīs who are the nature of the Supreme Horse.🔽Thus, in the sky surrounded by Vajraḍāka and so on, all migrating beings are ḍākas and ḍākinīs who are the nature of the Conqueror of the Three Worlds.🔽Thus, in the sky surrounded by Vajraḍāka and so on, all migrating beings are ḍākas and ḍākinīs who are the nature of whatever is desired by the mind, distinguished by the divisions of the family.

original: de skad du sangs rgyas kun gyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams bstan nas /
analyzed: de skad du sangs rgyas kun gyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the dakinis of all buddhas,

original: sdom pa bshad par bya ba'i phyir bde ba zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya @490b dang lhan cig mnyam par sbyor bas gang zhig shin tu bde ba dang ldan par skyed par byed do //
analyzed: sdom pa bshad par bya ba'i phyir bde ba zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya @490b dang lhan cig mnyam par sbyor bas gang zhig shin tu bde ba dang ldan par skyed par byed do //
translated: in order to explain the vow, “bliss” is that which is generated by the union of the Bhagavat with the wisdom seal of glorious Vajrasattva, which is endowed with supreme bliss.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: mchog ni khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: mchog ni khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
translated: “Supreme” is the most excellent.

original: bde ba thams cad kyi thabs phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad kyi thabs phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the best means for all bliss.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgyu ma thams cad kyi rab tu sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgyu ma thams cad kyi rab tu sbyor ba ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is the application of all illusions,

original: de 'ang gzhan nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang mnyam par sbyor bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de 'ang gzhan nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang mnyam par sbyor bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and that is not by the application of others, such as sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba'i rab tu sbyor ba nyid kyis gang zhig bde ba bskyed pa de nyid kyi phyir sam gyi sgras brjod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba'i rab tu sbyor ba nyid kyis gang zhig bde ba bskyed pa de nyid kyi phyir sam gyi sgras brjod do //
translated: Since it generates bliss by means of the application of the yoginīs’ network, which is the union with all buddhas, it is expressed by the term saṃ.🔽

original: de'i phyir de'i rgyus gang zhig bde ba mchog khyad par du 'phags pa skyed par byed pa de nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de'i rnam par dag pa sgyu ma lta bu'i chos rnams thams cad rtogs par snying rje chen po skye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rgyus gang zhig bde ba mchog khyad par du 'phags pa skyed par byed pa de nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de'i rnam par dag pa sgyu ma lta bu'i chos rnams thams cad rtogs par snying rje chen po skye'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of the generation of supreme bliss, it is the Great Compassion that realizes all things, which are like illusions, to be empty of the imagined reality that is the cause of the nirvana of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.🔽The word not is for the purpose of refuting the emptiness of the non-empty.

original: stong min zhes bya ba ni khams gsum dang / 'dod pa kun tu spyod pa'i yang dag pa ma yin par kun brtags pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir der yang dag pa ma yin par kun brtags pa stong pa yin pas dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong min zhes bya ba ni khams gsum dang / 'dod pa kun tu spyod pa'i yang dag pa ma yin par kun brtags pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir der yang dag pa ma yin par kun brtags pa stong pa yin pas dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-empty is the reality of the three realms, which is not the imagined reality of the enjoyment of desire. Since that is not empty, it is empty of the imagined reality.

original: stong pa min pa'ang min zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa min pa'ang min zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po med pa ste /
translated: “Nor is it non-empty” means that ultimately it is not the entity of the discriminations of grasped and grasper.

original: gang gi ye shes kyis gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pa mngon sum du bya @491a *//
analyzed: gang gi ye shes kyis gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pa mngon sum du bya @491a *//
translated: The wisdom by which one realizes the non-existence of the entities of grasped and grasper is

original: pa ste de'i ye shes kyang rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa ste de'i ye shes kyang rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: not an object, because that wisdom is not the domain of conceptualization.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de skad du yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi dbu mar rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de yang / shes rab pha rol phyin sbyor pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de skad du yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi dbu mar rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to // de yang / shes rab pha rol phyin sbyor pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said, “One should realize it in the middle free from the two extremes.”

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: And it is said, “The union with the perfection of wisdom”🔽means

original: de nyid kyi thabs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi thabs te /
translated: that it is the method of that very

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: union with the perfection of wisdom, because it is endowed with great compassion.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi snying rje'i bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa ni snying rje'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi snying rje'i bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa ni snying rje'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The object of the compassion of the Bhagavat Buddha is the nature of compassion.

original: de nas mdzes pa'i snying rje thabs zhes bya ba ni shin tu snying rje'ang mdzes pa'i snying rje ste /
analyzed: de nas mdzes pa'i snying rje thabs zhes bya ba ni shin tu snying rje'ang mdzes pa'i snying rje ste /
translated: Then, the method of beautiful compassion is the method of beautiful compassion, which is also very compassionate.

original: btang snyoms kyis dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyis dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po'o //
translated: It is the great compassion that is the objectless compassion of equanimity.

original: de nyid thabs te /
analyzed: de nyid thabs te /
translated: That itself is the method.

original: gang shin tu snying rje dang ldan pa'i thabs 'di ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gang shin tu snying rje dang ldan pa'i thabs 'di ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: This method that is endowed with great compassion is the nature of non-abiding nirvana.

original: dpal rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: dpal rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: It is the glorious Vairocana.

original: cir gyur pas zhe na /
analyzed: cir gyur pas zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: chos dag byung zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: chos dag byung zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: It is connected with the arising of phenomena.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang dag gas la zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang dag gas la zhe na /
translated: How is it the perfection of wisdom?

original: shes rab ces bya ba ni chos rnams sgyu ma lta bur rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam par brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab ces bya ba ni chos rnams sgyu ma lta bur rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam par brtag par bya ste /
translated: Wisdom is to be understood as the discrimination of phenomena as illusion-like.

original: de nyid bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: That itself is the perfection of the self.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni son pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni son pa ston pa ste /
translated: Perfection is taught as reaching.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin gsal ba /
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin gsal ba /
translated: The clear perfection of wisdom

original: zhe'o // gang gis zhe na /
analyzed: zhe'o // gang gis zhe na /
translated: is by whom?

original: rnam rtog med par lhag mos pas zhes so //
analyzed: rnam rtog med par lhag mos pas zhes so //
translated: By the imagination of the superimposition of the deity without discursive thought.

original: ci mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci mdzad ce na /
translated: What does he do?

original: brtags par ni sngon du @491b bdag po'i nus pa las zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: brtags par ni sngon du @491b bdag po'i nus pa las zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: He imagines the deity in front of himself, as if in a mirror, by the power of the lord.

original: ci brtags zhe na /
analyzed: ci brtags zhe na /
translated: What does he imagine?

original: brtags pa kun gyis zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rang dbang du sgyu ma lta bu'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: brtags pa kun gyis zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rang dbang du sgyu ma lta bu'i ngo bo'o //
translated: By all imaginations, he imagines the forms, etc. as having the nature of illusions, independent.

original: ci'i mtshan nyid rnams las zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i mtshan nyid rnams las zhe na /
translated: From what characteristics?

original: rnam rtog med pa'i chos rnams la //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i chos rnams la //
translated: From the characteristics of the dharmas without discursive thought.

original: sems can don ni yongs su brtags //
analyzed: sems can don ni yongs su brtags //
translated: He imagines the benefit of sentient beings.🔽By the power of compassion, he imagines the benefit of sentient beings as the cause.

original: zhes pa ni snying rje'i dbang gis sems can gyi don gyi don rgyur brtags pa'o; ;de brtags pas cir 'gyur zhe na /🔽sgra brnyan lta bur mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni snying rje'i dbang gis sems can gyi don gyi don rgyur brtags pa'o; ;de brtags pas cir 'gyur zhe na / sgra brnyan lta bur mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: What happens by that imagination?🔽He is equal to an echo.

original: sgra brnyan zhes bya ba ni brag ca'i sgra'o //
analyzed: sgra brnyan zhes bya ba ni brag ca'i sgra'o //
translated: An echo is a sound from a mountain.

original: des dbyangs mchog dang / mnyam zhing mnyam par dbyangs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / sgra rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas de sgra brnyan lta bur mnyam zhing de de ltar gyur pas brtag go /
analyzed: des dbyangs mchog dang / mnyam zhing mnyam par dbyangs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / sgra rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas de sgra brnyan lta bur mnyam zhing de de ltar gyur pas brtag go /
translated: That is the echo-like sameness, and that is the way it is to be investigated.🔽What is that?

original: de ci zhe na; de nas 'di ni chos ngag byung /
analyzed: de ci zhe na; de nas 'di ni chos ngag byung /
translated: Then this is the Dharma speech.

original: zhes bya ba ni de nas de'i phyir chos las chos kyi don gyi nges pa'i tshig so sor snang ba so sor rig pa ni brtags pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nas de'i phyir chos las chos kyi don gyi nges pa'i tshig so sor snang ba so sor rig pa ni brtags pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: This is the etymology of the term “Dharma speech”: the discernment of the discernment of the appearance of the meaning of the Dharma is the nature of the investigation.

original: de nyid phyir 'di ni dpal rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dam tshig gsum gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid phyir 'di ni dpal rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dam tshig gsum gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, this is the illuminator of the three commitments of Śrī Vairocana and so forth.

original: ngag gi chos ni ngag gi dbyangs zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de de ltar gyur pa ni ngag 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: ngag gi chos ni ngag gi dbyangs zhes bya ba'i don to // de de ltar gyur pa ni ngag 'byed pa ste /
translated: Dharma speech is the meaning of “speech melody.”🔽That is the way it is, the opening of speech.

original: ngag gi 'di ni de'i de bzhin du brjod do //
analyzed: ngag gi 'di ni de'i de bzhin du brjod do //
translated: This speech is expressed in that way.

original: de yang dag pa ma yin pa las grub pa ni chos ngag las grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang dag pa ma yin pa las grub pa ni chos ngag las grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is established from the authentic, because it is established from the Dharma.

original: theg pa dang / chen po de ni theg pa chen po @492a *//
analyzed: theg pa dang / chen po de ni theg pa chen po @492a *//
translated: That vehicle and the great are the Great Vehicle.

original: ste; byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ste; byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is the Bodhisattva path with its result.

original: chen po rnam pa bdun du sbyor ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde dag tu grub bo //
analyzed: chen po rnam pa bdun du sbyor ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde dag tu grub bo //
