translated: By pressing in stages and pressing strongly,

original: cho ga bcus mchog phyag @502a *//
analyzed: cho ga bcus mchog phyag @502a *//
translated: with the ten rites and the supreme mudrā,

original: rgya yis // khams gsum rgyal po chen po dang // rgyal ba'i bde ba nye bar spyod //
analyzed: rgya yis // khams gsum rgyal po chen po dang // rgyal ba'i bde ba nye bar spyod //
translated: one will enjoy the bliss of the great king of the three realms and the Victorious One.

original: dad ldan 'jig rten gsum rgyal ni //
analyzed: dad ldan 'jig rten gsum rgyal ni //
translated: The faithful one, the king of the three worlds,

original: phyag rgya bcug cing mnyam bcug dang // de bzhin glog ltar bcug pa nyid //
analyzed: phyag rgya bcug cing mnyam bcug dang // de bzhin glog ltar bcug pa nyid //
translated: inserts the mudrā, inserts equally, and likewise inserts like lightning.

original: phyag rgya bkug pa'i ting 'dzin gyis //
analyzed: phyag rgya bkug pa'i ting 'dzin gyis //
translated: By the samādhi of drawing in the mudrā,

original: de bzhin glog ltar bskor ba nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin glog ltar bskor ba nyid //
translated: and likewise turning like lightning,

original: 'og tu mnyam pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: 'og tu mnyam pa de bzhin du //
translated: below, equal, and likewise above,

original: steng gi phyogs su 'gro ba nyid //
analyzed: steng gi phyogs su 'gro ba nyid //
translated: One should go to the upper direction.

original: de bzhin gshegs 'dzin phyag rgya ni //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs 'dzin phyag rgya ni //
translated: The mudrā of holding the tathāgatas

original: gnas gsum dag tu bsgom par bya //
analyzed: gnas gsum dag tu bsgom par bya //
translated: should be meditated upon in the three places.

original: rgyan thams cad kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of all ornaments.

original: kun tu kun nas thams cad dang // rnam kun dus kun rang gi ni //
analyzed: kun tu kun nas thams cad dang // rnam kun dus kun rang gi ni //
translated: Everywhere, in every way, always,

original: gzhu yi rig byed phyag rgya 'dzin //
analyzed: gzhu yi rig byed phyag rgya 'dzin //
translated: one should hold the mudrā of the bow of the supreme syllable.

original: yi ge mchog ni 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: yi ge mchog ni 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: One will accomplish the supreme syllable.

original: mtshon cha thams cad kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mtshon cha thams cad kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of all weapons.

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: As for the “vajra of the buddhas,” this is Vairocana.

original: spyan gyi gzugs su gyur pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas sngags kyi yi ge las spyan phyung ste /
analyzed: spyan gyi gzugs su gyur pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas sngags kyi yi ge las spyan phyung ste /
translated: Having transformed into the form of Locanā, and endowed with the yoga of Vairocana, one should extract the eye from the mantra syllable.

original: zla ba gang ba dang / bum pa'i lag pa ma'i ma mo 'dod par bya ba dang / dbang bskur bar bsams na zhi ba skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zla ba gang ba dang / bum pa'i lag pa ma'i ma mo 'dod par bya ba dang / dbang bskur bar bsams na zhi ba skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: If one visualizes the full moon, the mother of the vase-handed one, the one to be desired, and the one to be consecrated, it generates peace.

original: shi ba rnams la srog sbyin par byed cing grub par 'dod pa la dngos po sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: shi ba rnams la srog sbyin par byed cing grub par 'dod pa la dngos po sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives life to the dead, and gives things to those who desire accomplishment.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje'i dam tshig la skul bar byed pa ni rdo rje'i dam tshig skul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje'i dam tshig la skul bar byed pa ni rdo rje'i dam tshig skul bar byed pa'o //
translated: The vajra pledge and so on: the one who impels the vajra pledge is the vajra pledge impeller.

original: thugs kyi rdo @502b rje'i sku gsum 'bar ba'i mchog gi dam tshig ni m'a ma ki'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: thugs kyi rdo @502b rje'i sku gsum 'bar ba'i mchog gi dam tshig ni m'a ma ki'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The pledge of the supreme blazing of the three bodies of the mind vajra is the characteristic of Māmakī.

original: gang du ting nge 'dzin la de ni de bzhin du brjod do //
analyzed: gang du ting nge 'dzin la de ni de bzhin du brjod do //
translated: Where that is the meditative concentration, it is expressed in that way.

original: rdo rje'i rigs kyi sngags kyi yi ge dkar po phyung nas; de'i tshe bsgrub bya'i lus la gang bar bsgom par byas na sdig pa 'jig par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs kyi sngags kyi yi ge dkar po phyung nas; de'i tshe bsgrub bya'i lus la gang bar bsgom par byas na sdig pa 'jig par byed pa yin no //
translated: When the white mantra syllable of the vajra family is emitted, and at that time one visualizes it filling the body of the one to be subdued, it destroys evil.

original: zhi ba la ma mo spyan dang ldan pa lta bur bya ba dang / rgyas pa la ni rin po che'i bum pa nas rin po che'i char ba 'byin par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la ma mo spyan dang ldan pa lta bur bya ba dang / rgyas pa la ni rin po che'i bum pa nas rin po che'i char ba 'byin par bsam par bya'o //
translated: In pacification, one should visualize her as having the eyes of a mother, and in enrichment, one should imagine a rain of jewels pouring from a jeweled vase.

original: 'dod chags chen po la 'od dpag tu med pa'i gang gi padmas gtses pa de'i gar gyis phye ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po la 'od dpag tu med pa'i gang gi padmas gtses pa de'i gar gyis phye ba ste /
translated: The lotus of Amitābha is struck by the dance of him who is tormented by great passion.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i kun byed pa ni rigs kun gyi bdag po nyid can /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i kun byed pa ni rigs kun gyi bdag po nyid can /
translated: The all-creator who is in this condition is the lord of all families.

original: gang gi kun byed pa ni thams cad do //
analyzed: gang gi kun byed pa ni thams cad do //
translated: The all-creator is everything.

original: 'dis ni byas pa de'i dmigs pas ting nge 'dzin la rdo rje dmigs par de bzhin du brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni byas pa de'i dmigs pas ting nge 'dzin la rdo rje dmigs par de bzhin du brjod do //
translated: By the object of that creation, the vajra is expressed in the samādhi in the same way.

original: rdo rje ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: rdo rje ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The vajra is Vairocana.

original: padma ni 'od dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: padma ni 'od dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: The lotus is Amitābha.

original: sngags kyi yi ge gser gyi kha dog lta bu phyung nas sgrub po la mngon par dbang bskur byed na rgyal po chen po skyed par byed do //
analyzed: sngags kyi yi ge gser gyi kha dog lta bu phyung nas sgrub po la mngon par dbang bskur byed na rgyal po chen po skyed par byed do //
translated: If the practitioner emits the mantra syllable, which is the color of gold, and bestows consecration upon himself, he will generate the great king.

original: de rnams kyi spro ba dang bsdu bar byed pa dag sgom par byed na chos kyi mdzod 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi spro ba dang bsdu bar byed pa dag sgom par byed na chos kyi mdzod 'phel bar byed do //
translated: If he meditates on the emanation and withdrawal of those, he will increase the treasury of the Dharma.

original: rang gi snying ga'i padma'i snying por nang du gnas par bsgrub bya sngags kyi yi ge'i phreng bas byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i padma'i snying por nang du gnas par bsgrub bya sngags kyi yi ge'i phreng bas byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: One should bless the object of protection with the mantra garland, located within the heart lotus, in the heart.🔽Having made the crown with the crossed vajra, one should enter into union just as before.

original: sna tshogs rdo rjes spyi bor byas nas ji lta ba bzhin du snyoms par 'jug par byed na srung ba chen po byed par @503a *//🔽'gyur ro // thams cad dbang du gyur pas rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / dbang du gyur pa la sogs de rnams rtog par byed pa dang / skyed par byed pa de ni don yod rdo rje can te /🔽de nyid rdo rje gsung mnyam pa nyid kyis dga' bar byed pa'o //🔽rdo rje ni mi phyed pa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rjes spyi bor byas nas ji lta ba bzhin du snyoms par 'jug par byed na srung ba chen po byed par @503a *// 'gyur ro // thams cad dbang du gyur pas rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / dbang du gyur pa la sogs de rnams rtog par byed pa dang / skyed par byed pa de ni don yod rdo rje can te / de nyid rdo rje gsung mnyam pa nyid kyis dga' bar byed pa'o // rdo rje ni mi phyed pa ste /
translated: One should do the great protection.

original: gang du ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas sngags kyi yi ge dmar po phyug ste /🔽des bsgrub par bya ba dag par bya zhing bzlas pa byed na mngag gzhug par byed do //
analyzed: gang du ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas sngags kyi yi ge dmar po phyug ste /🔽des bsgrub par bya ba dag par bya zhing bzlas pa byed na mngag gzhug par byed do //
translated: The one who is Amoghavajra, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is the cause of the subjugation of all, and so forth, who is

original: ye shes kyis kun sgrol bas sgrol ma zhas bya ba ni ye shes 'jug par byed ma can no //
analyzed: ye shes kyis kun sgrol bas sgrol ma zhas bya ba ni ye shes 'jug par byed ma can no //
translated: The one called Tārā is the one who causes the entry of intuition, because she liberates all by means of intuition.

original: de'i tshe dmigs pa'i phyir de de bzhin du gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe dmigs pa'i phyir de de bzhin du gsungs so //
translated: At that time, she is called Tārā because she is the object of intuition.

original: ye shes sna tshogs ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes sna tshogs te /
analyzed: ye shes sna tshogs ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes sna tshogs te /
translated: The various intuitions are the various supramundane intuitions.

original: rdo rje gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i khro bo rnams de dag nyid kyis gdug pa rnams 'dul ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: rdo rje gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i khro bo rnams de dag nyid kyis gdug pa rnams 'dul ba'i don du ste /
translated: The various wrathful ones are Vajra-Yama and so on, who are for the purpose of subduing the wicked by means of those very [intuitions].

original: de rnams ni gur nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams ni gur nyid do //
translated: Those are the very [intuitions].

original: mdzes pa ni yan lag dang / nying lag dman pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mdzes pa ni yan lag dang / nying lag dman pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The beautiful are those whose major and minor body parts are not deficient.

original: srubs med pa ni dum bu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: srubs med pa ni dum bu gcig pa'o //
translated: The without cracks are the single-piece [ones].

original: srubs gnyis pa ni dum bu gnyis pa ste /🔽'di dag nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srubs gnyis pa ni dum bu gnyis pa ste / 'di dag nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two-piece are the two-piece [ones].

original: rkang pa'i rjes kyi rdul gyi cho ga zhes bya ba ni de brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: rkang pa'i rjes kyi rdul gyi cho ga zhes bya ba ni de brjod pa yin te /
translated: Because this is the very occasion, [the verse] says the procedure of the dust of the footprints.

original: gshin rje mthar byed kyi rnal 'byor pa lha mo bzhi'i rnal 'byor dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: gshin rje mthar byed kyi rnal 'byor pa lha mo bzhi'i rnal 'byor dang ldan zhing /
translated: The one who is a practitioner of Yama-Slayer, endowed with the practice of the four goddesses,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lngas byin gyis @503b brlabs pas bsgrub par bya ba'i rkang rjes kyi rdul gyis de'i gzugs brnyan byas nas thod pa'i nang du gzhug par bya ste /🔽de nyid la gzhug pa dang / bcing pa byas nas rkang pa g-yon pas de mnan te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lngas byin gyis @503b brlabs pas bsgrub par bya ba'i rkang rjes kyi rdul gyis de'i gzugs brnyan byas nas thod pa'i nang du gzhug par bya ste / de nyid la gzhug pa dang / bcing pa byas nas rkang pa g-yon pas de mnan te /
translated: Having made an image of him with the dust of his footprint, consecrated by the five Tathagatas, one should place it in the skull.🔽Having placed it there and bound it, one should press it down with one's left foot.

original: ji srid khugs par gyur pa de srid du bskul ba dang bcas par bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid khugs par gyur pa de srid du bskul ba dang bcas par bzla bar bya'o //
translated: One should recite with invocation until he is subdued.

original: sku gsum mi phyed sgom pa yis /
analyzed: sku gsum mi phyed sgom pa yis /
translated: By meditating on the indivisible three bodies,

original: zhes bya bas ni rang gi lha'i nga rgyal brtan pas bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni rang gi lha'i nga rgyal brtan pas bsgoms pas so //
translated: one should meditate with firm pride in one's deity.

original: gti mug chen po'i mchog ni don yod rdo rje can te /
analyzed: gti mug chen po'i mchog ni don yod rdo rje can te /
translated: The supreme great delusion is Amoghasiddhi.

original: de'i ye shes ni rdo rje rtse mo las skyes pa'i byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: de'i ye shes ni rdo rje rtse mo las skyes pa'i byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: His wisdom is the bodhicitta born from the tip of the vajra.

original: de'i phyir bdud rtsi'i khro bo ni gang du ting nge 'dzin la de de bzhin du brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdud rtsi'i khro bo ni gang du ting nge 'dzin la de de bzhin du brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the wrathful nectar is where the samadhi is expressed as such.

original: tshogs kyi bdag por rkang par bcug pa zhes bya ba ni bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas bsgrub par bya ba'i rkang rjes kyi rdul de'i gzugs brnyan bong bu'i gcin gyis byas nas mi dge ba'i phyag rgya byas nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi
analyzed: tshogs kyi bdag por rkang par bcug pa zhes bya ba ni bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas bsgrub par bya ba'i rkang rjes kyi rdul de'i gzugs brnyan bong bu'i gcin gyis byas nas mi dge ba'i phyag rgya byas nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi
translated: The line placed in the foot of the lord of the assembly means that one should make an effigy of the target with donkey urine, and with the yoga of Amṛtakuṇḍali, place it in the foot of the target's footprint, which is the place of the lord of the assembly.🔽 One should write the name of the target with charnel ground ash on a leaf of the wind mandala, which is a leaf of the tree of the wind mandala, and place the five effigies on its back.

original: 'dab ma las s'a lu btags par byas pa dang / dur khrod kyi sol bas bsgrub bya'i ming khro bo'i nang du chud par mngon par bris shing gzugs brnyan lnga rgyab tu bzhag nas rdo rje log par 'dren pa bkug nas mchod de /
analyzed: 'dab ma las s'a lu btags par byas pa dang / dur khrod kyi sol bas bsgrub bya'i ming khro bo'i nang du chud par mngon par bris shing gzugs brnyan lnga rgyab tu bzhag nas rdo rje log par 'dren pa bkug nas mchod de /
translated: One should summon the vajra-leading spirit and make offerings to it.

original: de'i rkang pa dag tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rkang pa dag tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should place the effigies in its feet.

original: de bya'o zhes bya ba ni de srid du sngags kyi mthar h'um brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bya'o zhes bya ba ni de srid du sngags kyi mthar h'um brjod par bya'o //
translated: The line one should do this means that one should recite hūṃ at the end of the mantra.

original: gang gi tshe rlung gis bar chad du gyur pa de'i tshe gong du gsungs @504a *//
analyzed: gang gi tshe rlung gis bar chad du gyur pa de'i tshe gong du gsungs @504a *//
translated: When the wind is an obstacle, one should do as stated above.

original: pa'i rim pas stong pa nyid dmigs nas bdag nyid dpal rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs su bskyed pa bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: pa'i rim pas stong pa nyid dmigs nas bdag nyid dpal rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs su bskyed pa bka' stsal pa /
translated: Having contemplated emptiness in stages, one should generate oneself in the form of glorious Vairocana.

original: rlung gis phyogs su dri nag pos dkyil 'khor gru bzhi bar thig le bdun ya yig so so'i nang du byas pa ni de'i dbus su thig le bdun po ste /
analyzed: rlung gis phyogs su dri nag pos dkyil 'khor gru bzhi bar thig le bdun ya yig so so'i nang du byas pa ni de'i dbus su thig le bdun po ste /
translated: In the direction of the wind, on a square mandala with black scent, there are seven drops with ya syllables inside each. In the middle of those, there are seven drops.

original: thig le bdun po 'di rnams las rlung lha bdun ri dvags las zhon zhing mdog nag pa'o //
analyzed: thig le bdun po 'di rnams las rlung lha bdun ri dvags las zhon zhing mdog nag pa'o //
translated: From these seven drops, the seven wind gods arise, riding deer and black in color.

original: de la rang gi sa bon las byung ba ni des rang gi snying ga las bton pa ste //🔽'phags pa mi g-yo mgon nam /
analyzed: de la rang gi sa bon las byung ba ni des rang gi snying ga las bton pa ste // 'phags pa mi g-yo mgon nam /
translated: From their own seed syllables, they emerge from one's heart.

original: 'dod pa'i rgyal pos bkug nas zhags pas bcing bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyal pos bkug nas zhags pas bcing bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should think of them as being summoned by the king of desire and bound by a noose.

original: de nas kham phor gyis zhes bya ba ni h'um sum h'um zhes bya ba las ri rab kyi gzugs rva brgyad dang ldan pa bskyed nas /
analyzed: de nas kham phor gyis zhes bya ba ni h'um sum h'um zhes bya ba las ri rab kyi gzugs rva brgyad dang ldan pa bskyed nas /
translated: Then, with a clay pot means that from the syllable hūṃ suṃ hūṃ, one should generate the form of Mount Meru with eight sides,

original: kha 'og tu phug nas bzhag pa ni rdo rje 'ching ba chen po yin no //
analyzed: kha 'og tu phug nas bzhag pa ni rdo rje 'ching ba chen po yin no //
translated: and placing it with the mouth facing down is the great vajra binding.

original: rang gi sngags bzlas pa ni de'i thig le bdun sngags kyis sbas nas dbugs kyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi sngags bzlas pa ni de'i thig le bdun sngags kyis sbas nas dbugs kyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite one’s own mantra, and conceal the seven syllables of that mantra with the breath.

original: de'i steng du'ang lam gyis dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa kha dog ser po'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du'ang lam gyis dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa kha dog ser po'o //
translated: Above that, one should visualize a square maṇḍala of great wind, yellow in color.

original: der yang rtse lnga pa chen po las mtha' yas pa'i 'od zer las khro bo 'jigs pa spro bar bya zhing /
analyzed: der yang rtse lnga pa chen po las mtha' yas pa'i 'od zer las khro bo 'jigs pa spro bar bya zhing /
translated: There, one should emanate wrathful ones from the great five-pronged [vajra], terrifying with limitless light rays.

original: khro bo rdo rjes mnan par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo rdo rjes mnan par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the wrathful ones pressing down with a vajra.

original: de'i steng du rkang pa g-yon pa bzhag nas /
analyzed: de'i steng du rkang pa g-yon pa bzhag nas /
translated: Having placed the left foot on top of that,

original: 'phags pa mi g-yo mgon gyi sngags brgya rtsa brgyad du bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa mi g-yo mgon gyi sngags brgya rtsa brgyad du bzla bar bya'o //
translated: one should recite the mantra of Noble Acala one hundred and eight times.

original: rdo rje'i steng du bcom ldan 'das @504b rnam par snang mdzad dang / 'phags pa mi g-yo mgon zhabs g-yas brkyang bas thams cad gnon cing bcom ldan 'das kyi mngon du lag na ral gri dang / zhags pas rlung bsdigs par bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i steng du bcom ldan 'das @504b rnam par snang mdzad dang / 'phags pa mi g-yo mgon zhabs g-yas brkyang bas thams cad gnon cing bcom ldan 'das kyi mngon du lag na ral gri dang / zhags pas rlung bsdigs par bsam par bya ste /
translated: On top of the vajra, one should visualize Bhagavat Vairocana and Noble Acala, pressing down on everything with the right leg extended, and imagine that the Bhagavat, with a sword and noose in his hands, is threatening the wind.

original: de skad du 'jigs pa'i dus kyi rlung thams cad kyang bcing ba byas par 'gyur ro //🔽char 'bab pa'i don du stobs po che zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris nas de'i 'dab ma brgyad la mtha' yas dang / rigs ldan dang / nor rgyas kyi bu dang / dung skyong dang / 'jog po dang /
analyzed: de skad du 'jigs pa'i dus kyi rlung thams cad kyang bcing ba byas par 'gyur ro // char 'bab pa'i don du stobs po che zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris nas de'i 'dab ma brgyad la mtha' yas dang / rigs ldan dang / nor rgyas kyi bu dang / dung skyong dang / 'jog po dang /
translated: In that way, all the winds of fearsome times will be bound.🔽For the sake of rain, draw a lotus with eight petals and write the names of the eight nāgas—Ananta, Kulika, Vāsuki, Śaṅkhapāla, Takṣaka,🔽Mahāpadma, Manasśaṅkha, and Padma—in the eight directions, yellow and white in the order of the self, with their seed syllables.

original: padma chen po dang / stobs kyi rgyu dang / padma zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi rim pa las ser po dang / dkar po gnyis sha sha sa h'a svam sv'a sam sva rang gi sa bon gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i klu brgyad po rnams snying po brgyad kyi nang du gnas pa'i rnga ma la bkug nas mchod de /
analyzed: padma chen po dang / stobs kyi rgyu dang / padma zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi rim pa las ser po dang / dkar po gnyis sha sha sa h'a svam sv'a sam sva rang gi sa bon gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i klu brgyad po rnams snying po brgyad kyi nang du gnas pa'i rnga ma la bkug nas mchod de /
translated: Having summoned the eight nāgas to the center of the eight petals, make offerings.

original: 'di bzhugs pa'i khro bo'i tshogs sku 'bar ba'i tshogs kyi bdag nyid h'um ni h'um zhes mchog tu bzlas pas zhabs kyi 'og tu klu rnams gzir bar sgom par byed na char mchog tu rab tu 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di bzhugs pa'i khro bo'i tshogs sku 'bar ba'i tshogs kyi bdag nyid h'um ni h'um zhes mchog tu bzlas pas zhabs kyi 'og tu klu rnams gzir bar sgom par byed na char mchog tu rab tu 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one visualizes the assembly of wrathful ones abiding here, the nature of the assembly of blazing bodies, and the hum hum of supreme recitation, the nagas are suppressed under one's feet, and one causes the supreme rain to fall.

original: char bzlog pa'i don bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: char bzlog pa'i don bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat declares the meaning of averting rain:

original: bdag nyid khro bo'i gzugs nyi ma'i mdog gi 'od ltar shin tu dmar ba bsams nas rang gi kha ru h'um 'bar ba'i lce nam mkha'i tshad 'dis dral zhing yongs su gang ba las sprin snying ga'i sbubs kyis dbugs kyis 'gugs shing @505a *//
analyzed: bdag nyid khro bo'i gzugs nyi ma'i mdog gi 'od ltar shin tu dmar ba bsams nas rang gi kha ru h'um 'bar ba'i lce nam mkha'i tshad 'dis dral zhing yongs su gang ba las sprin snying ga'i sbubs kyis dbugs kyis 'gugs shing @505a *//
translated: Having visualized oneself in the form of a wrathful one, extremely red like the light of the sun, one should tear open the sky-sized tongue of the blazing hum in one's mouth with this, and fill it. From the cloud in the cavity of the heart, one draws in with the breath,

original: dbugs phyin pas ras bal gyis bur ma ltar gtor bar byed do //
analyzed: dbugs phyin pas ras bal gyis bur ma ltar gtor bar byed do //
translated: and scatters like cotton wool with the exhalation.

original: yang na rang gi phyag rgya'i tshogs 'bar bar bton pas dral zhing bcad nas h'um gis mchog tu bsdigs par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rang gi phyag rgya'i tshogs 'bar bar bton pas dral zhing bcad nas h'um gis mchog tu bsdigs par bya'o //
translated: Or, having torn open and cut with the blazing hum of one's own assembly of consorts, one should threaten with the supreme hum.

original: de gzhig pa'i don bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de gzhig pa'i don bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat declares the meaning of destroying that:

original: me'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtag pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas rang gi dpral ba nas 'phags pa mi g-yo mgon ram las byung ba bton nas me la gnas pa phyag drug pa g-yon kshim las sdigs mdzub dang / zhags pa h'um gi nang du bcug pa dang /
analyzed: me'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtag pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas rang gi dpral ba nas 'phags pa mi g-yo mgon ram las byung ba bton nas me la gnas pa phyag drug pa g-yon kshim las sdigs mdzub dang / zhags pa h'um gi nang du bcug pa dang /
translated: The fire mandala and so forth: Endowed with the yoga of permanence, one should emit Ārya Acalanātha from one's forehead, born from raṃ, abiding in the fire, with six arms, the left [hand] with a threatening forefinger arisen from kṣiṃ, and a noose inserted into the interior of a hūṃ.

original: de yis gzhu 'o //
analyzed: de yis gzhu 'o //
translated: That [hand] holds a bow.

original: g-yas pa na kham las ral gri dang / ho las mda' dang / h'um gis rdo rje 'dzin par bsams nas /
analyzed: g-yas pa na kham las ral gri dang / ho las mda' dang / h'um gis rdo rje 'dzin par bsams nas /
translated: The right [hand] holds a sword arisen from khaṃ, an arrow arisen from hoḥ, and a vajra arisen from hūṃ.

original: de nyid kyi 'od zer gyi khro bo dang lhan cig pas bgegs thams cad h'um gi sgra bsgrags pas 'bar ba'i ral gri la sogs pas bsnun pa la sogs pa dang / mda' 'phangs pas phigs pas skyes pa'i bgegs gzhom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'od zer gyi khro bo dang lhan cig pas bgegs thams cad h'um gi sgra bsgrags pas 'bar ba'i ral gri la sogs pas bsnun pa la sogs pa dang / mda' 'phangs pas phigs pas skyes pa'i bgegs gzhom par bya'o //
translated: Having imagined that, with the light rays of that [vajra] together with the wrathful ones, all obstructors are struck by the blazing sword and so forth, and so forth, by the sound of hūṃ, and by the arrow shot by the obstructor of the male being destroyed.

original: skyes pa'i khrag chen po la sogs pa ni rkang rjes kyi rdul dang / skyes pa'i khrag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i gzugs brnyan byas nas /
analyzed: skyes pa'i khrag chen po la sogs pa ni rkang rjes kyi rdul dang / skyes pa'i khrag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i gzugs brnyan byas nas /
translated: The great blood of the male and so forth, the dust of the footprint, and the blood of the male, having made an effigy of the victim,

original: skyes pa'i rus pa'i phur bu dag la 'od zer can gyi sngags nyi shus mngon par bsngags te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rus pa'i phur bu dag la 'od zer can gyi sngags nyi shus mngon par bsngags te /
translated: The bone dagger of a man is consecrated with the mantra of Ugra twenty times.

original: mig la phur bas btab nas tshogs kyi bdag po'i khar gzhug go /
analyzed: mig la phur bas btab nas tshogs kyi bdag po'i khar gzhug go /
translated: Having struck the eye with the dagger, one should insert it into the mouth of Gaṇapati.

original: aom sumbha rdo rje gtun shing dang tho bas dang po kha dang / gtun shing gis rgyab @505b tu brdung bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sumbha rdo rje gtun shing dang tho bas dang po kha dang / gtun shing gis rgyab @505b tu brdung bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: With the vajra pestle and hammer, one should imagine that he is first struck in the mouth and then on the back with the pestle.

original: 'bar ba gzhom pa'i don du ming /
analyzed: 'bar ba gzhom pa'i don du ming /
translated: For the purpose of extinguishing the blazing fire, the name🔽“medicine” is uttered.

original: sman gyi kha dog ces bya ba la sogs pas ni nam mkha'i gnas su h'um ga:h'um zhes nang du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: sman gyi kha dog ces bya ba la sogs pas ni nam mkha'i gnas su h'um ga:h'um zhes nang du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: With the words “the color of medicine,” and so forth, one should draw in the space element with the sound hūṃ.

original: phu:'i yig 'bru las skyes ba klu nag po stong phrag gis bskor ba'i nam mkha' lding gis bka' stsal par bya'o //
analyzed: phu:'i yig 'bru las skyes ba klu nag po stong phrag gis bskor ba'i nam mkha' lding gis bka' stsal par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the garuḍa, born from the syllable phu, surrounded by a thousand black nāgas, utters the command.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du bsgoms te /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du bsgoms te /
translated: Having meditated just as before,

original: aom badzra n'a ra ye na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dang bor bskul te /
analyzed: aom badzra n'a ra ye na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dang bor bskul te /
translated: one should first incite with the words “Oṃ vajra nārāyaṇa” and so forth.

original: des brgya byin yang bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: des brgya byin yang bskul bar bya'o //
translated: With that, one should incite Indra.

original: 'di yang de char gyi sprin la char gyi don du bka' stsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di yang de char gyi sprin la char gyi don du bka' stsal bar bya ste /
translated: This is like the cloud that rains for that purpose.

original: bka' thos na yang char 'bebs pas sprin phyir bzlog pa ni yid kyis bsam par byed na nam mkha' lding gi gshog pas zlog par byed cing mchus bsnun pas chu bo'i mtshams byed do //
analyzed: bka' thos na yang char 'bebs pas sprin phyir bzlog pa ni yid kyis bsam par byed na nam mkha' lding gi gshog pas zlog par byed cing mchus bsnun pas chu bo'i mtshams byed do //
translated: If one hears the command, it rains. If one wishes to turn back the cloud, one should think with the mind. If one turns it back with the wings of Garuḍa, one should strike with the beak and make a boundary for the river.

original: rdo rje phyir bzlog pa'i don bka' stsal to //
analyzed: rdo rje phyir bzlog pa'i don bka' stsal to //
translated: The meaning of the Vajra Repelling is stated.

original: sbyin sreg ces bya ba la sogs pas ni dge ba byed pa'i phyir zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dang / dbang du byed pa'i mtshan nyid la ni gtsubs pa las byung ba'i mes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin sreg ces bya ba la sogs pas ni dge ba byed pa'i phyir zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dang / dbang du byed pa'i mtshan nyid la ni gtsubs pa las byung ba'i mes bya'o //
translated: In the case of the rite of pacification, increase, and subjugation, which are virtuous, one should perform with the fire that arises from friction.

original: mngon spyod la ni dur khrod kyi mes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon spyod la ni dur khrod kyi mes bya'o //
translated: In the case of the rite of assault, one should perform with the fire of a charnel ground.

original: thab khung zhes bya ba ni zlum po dang / gru bzhi dang / zla ba phyed pa dang / gru gsum mo //
analyzed: thab khung zhes bya ba ni zlum po dang / gru bzhi dang / zla ba phyed pa dang / gru gsum mo //
translated: The hearth is round, square, half-moon, and triangular.

original: de ltar thab khung gi mtha' mar dkar po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / nag po dang / padma rnams kyang gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar thab khung gi mtha' mar dkar po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / nag po dang / padma rnams kyang gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should place white, yellow, red, black, and lotus petals around the hearth.

original: de nas de'i mdog ltar gtsug gtor dang / chu skyes dang / rin po che dang / rdo rje 'bar ba rnams bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas de'i mdog ltar gtsug gtor dang / chu skyes dang / rin po che dang / rdo rje 'bar ba rnams bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then, one should make the crest-jewel, the lotus, the jewel, and the blazing vajra, according to its color.

original: @506a *// las kun byed pa bzlas pas ni zhes bya ba ni h'um gis mngon par bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: @506a *// las kun byed pa bzlas pas ni zhes bya ba ni h'um gis mngon par bsngags pa'o //
translated: By the recitation of the all-action mantra means by the mantra hum.🔽 The action of the left vajra means making the left hand into a three-pronged vajra.

original: g-yon pa'i rdo rjes bya ba ni lag pa g-yon pa rdo rje rtse gsum pa can du byas pa'o; ;las kyi 'od kyis rnam par brgyan pa zhes bya ba ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi ci rigs par 'od kyis rnam par spras pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i rdo rjes bya ba ni lag pa g-yon pa rdo rje rtse gsum pa can du byas pa'o; ;las kyi 'od kyis rnam par brgyan pa zhes bya ba ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi ci rigs par 'od kyis rnam par spras pa'o //
translated: Adorned with the light of action means adorned with the light of the pacifying and other actions as appropriate.

original: 'bar ba'i rnam pas yongs su thim par byas pa'o zhes pa la //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i rnam pas yongs su thim par byas pa'o zhes pa la //
translated: Having made it blaze, one should cause it to dissolve means

original: 'bar ba ni lha'am /
analyzed: 'bar ba ni lha'am /
translated: the blazing is either of the deity or

original: 'bar ba ni gtsigs pa'i gzugs kyis te /
analyzed: 'bar ba ni gtsigs pa'i gzugs kyis te /
translated: the blazing is in the form of a flame.

original: de bzhin du ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi cho ga bsgom par bya zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi cho ga bsgom par bya zhing /
translated: Likewise, one should meditate on the ritual of the nature of pristine awareness.

original: aom dang po dang / mthar sv'ah'a las mchog tu gnas nas zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dang / dbang dang / mngon spyod la khro bo'i tshogs kyis h'um dang bcas pa'i phat kyis sngags bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom dang po dang / mthar sv'ah'a las mchog tu gnas nas zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dang / dbang dang / mngon spyod la khro bo'i tshogs kyis h'um dang bcas pa'i phat kyis sngags bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Having remained in the supreme state, with the syllable OṂ at the beginning and SVĀHĀ at the end, one should recite the mantra with the assembly of wrathful ones and with HŪṂ and PHAṬ for pacifying, increasing, controlling, and destroying.

original: thog ma dang tha mar sreg blugs gang bar dbul /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha mar sreg blugs gang bar dbul /
translated: One should offer oblations at the beginning and at the end, filled with the oblation.

original: kha dgang ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni lha'i zhal gyi padmar sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: kha dgang ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni lha'i zhal gyi padmar sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: The words “with the mouth open” mean that one should offer oblations into the lotus mouth of the deity.

original: bshad gci la sogs pa'i sreg blugs la sdig pa la sogs pa'i dogs pa mi bya ste /
analyzed: bshad gci la sogs pa'i sreg blugs la sdig pa la sogs pa'i dogs pa mi bya ste /
translated: One should not fear sin and so on in the oblation of feces and urine and so on,

original: gang gi phyir don dam par rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'i phyir thams cad rnam par rtog pa tsam mo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam par rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'i phyir thams cad rnam par rtog pa tsam mo //
translated: because ultimately everything is mere imagination, since it is pure by nature.

original: de bzhin du dbang po gnyis snyoms par zhugs pas kyang lha'i nga rgyal sngon du bya ba dang / thabs dang / shes rab ro gcig pa mngon du byed cing zag pa med pa'i ye shes skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po gnyis snyoms par zhugs pas kyang lha'i nga rgyal sngon du bya ba dang / thabs dang / shes rab ro gcig pa mngon du byed cing zag pa med pa'i ye shes skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Likewise, by the union of the two organs, one should generate the pride of the deity beforehand, and manifest the single taste of method and wisdom, and generate uncontaminated wisdom.

original: sku la sogs pa yang dag par bstan @506b bar bya ba bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sku la sogs pa yang dag par bstan @506b bar bya ba bka' stsal pa /
translated: The body, etc., are to be shown as real.

original: bud med dang ni skyes ba'i lus /
analyzed: bud med dang ni skyes ba'i lus /
translated: The body of a woman or a man🔽is generated by many actions.

original: las ni du mas bskyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par bstan pa zhes bya bas ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi mtshan nyid shes pa'i skyes bu'o //
analyzed: las ni du mas bskyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par bstan pa zhes bya bas ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi mtshan nyid shes pa'i skyes bu'o //
translated: By the statement beginning with the characteristic of virtuous and non-virtuous actions up to the person who knows, it is shown that the body is generated by many actions.

original: sha dang rkang la sogs pa dag ni rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sha dang rkang la sogs pa dag ni rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The flesh, bones, etc. are the nature of Vairocana, Akshobhya, etc.

original: 'di'i phyir bsten pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir bsten pa'o //
translated: For this reason, they are to be relied upon.

original: gang zhig 'dod chags zhe sdang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed 'phel ba bshad ba dang gci ba la sogs pa lnga yongs su 'dzag pa ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhi'i rang bzhin rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dod chags zhe sdang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed 'phel ba bshad ba dang gci ba la sogs pa lnga yongs su 'dzag pa ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhi'i rang bzhin rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The five excretions, feces, etc., are the complete nature of the four elements, earth, etc.

original: bsgoms pa las zhes bya ba ni brtags pa dang bral ba'i blo gros kyis so //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las zhes bya ba ni brtags pa dang bral ba'i blo gros kyis so //
translated: The word cultivated means by the intellect free from conceptualization.

original: de nas mchog tu rab bshad bya //
analyzed: de nas mchog tu rab bshad bya //
translated: Then, the supreme should be explained.

original: thams cad las ni sna tshogs mchog /
analyzed: thams cad las ni sna tshogs mchog /
translated: The supreme of all varieties

original: ces bya ba ji snyed du gru bzhi dang / sgo bzhi pa dang / sgo'i skyong ba dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ji snyed du gru bzhi dang / sgo bzhi pa dang / sgo'i skyong ba dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: is the square with four doors, endowed with door-keepers.

original: tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor brtag par bya /
analyzed: tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor brtag par bya /
translated: The mandala of the assembly should be imagined.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is said to be the external mandala.

original: da ni nang gi dkyil 'khor bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni nang gi dkyil 'khor bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, the internal mandala should be explained.

original: kun las sna tshogs phyag rgya zhes pa la sogs pa ni dpal sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: kun las sna tshogs phyag rgya zhes pa la sogs pa ni dpal sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The varieties of all seals, etc., are endowed with the goddesses such as Shri Buddha Lochana.

original: kun las sna tshogs 'khor lo can zhes bya ba ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gang du gsungs pa'i gnas su bkod nas de'i rjes su mtshams bzhi po rnams su drag mo la sogs pa'i sngags dang phyag rgyas byin gyis @507a *//
analyzed: kun las sna tshogs 'khor lo can zhes bya ba ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gang du gsungs pa'i gnas su bkod nas de'i rjes su mtshams bzhi po rnams su drag mo la sogs pa'i sngags dang phyag rgyas byin gyis @507a *//
translated: The one called the various wheel of all is the glorious Vajrasattva. Having arranged him in the place where he is taught, after that, in the four directions, one should consecrate with the mantras and seals of Raudrī and so forth.

original: brlabs nas / seng ldeng gi phur ba sor brgyad pa dang / rdo rje tho bas de'i sngags bzlas nas brdung zhing lte ba dang / drag mo la sogs pa'i mtshams rnams su rim pas mtha' yas dang / rnam par rgyal ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i phur bas btab ste /
analyzed: brlabs nas / seng ldeng gi phur ba sor brgyad pa dang / rdo rje tho bas de'i sngags bzlas nas brdung zhing lte ba dang / drag mo la sogs pa'i mtshams rnams su rim pas mtha' yas dang / rnam par rgyal ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i phur bas btab ste /
translated: The one called the wheel of the various is the glorious Vajrasattva. Having arranged him in the place where he is taught, after that, in the four intermediate directions, having blessed with the mantras and seals of Rudra and so forth, with an acacia dagger eight fingerbreadths long and a vajra hammer, one should strike with his mantra, and at the navel and in the intermediate directions of Rudra and so forth, one should sequentially plant the daggers called Ananta, Vijaya, and so forth.

original: dkyil 'khor ba sta gon la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba sta gon la gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should establish the mandala in the pledge.

original: dri la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi gnas kyi lha thams cad kyi gnas su rang gi h'um dang / de'i mtshan dang por bzlas nas mngon par gtor zhing /
analyzed: dri la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi gnas kyi lha thams cad kyi gnas su rang gi h'um dang / de'i mtshan dang por bzlas nas mngon par gtor zhing /
translated: With scent and so forth, in the place of the mandala, in the place of all deities, having recited one's hum and his name at the beginning, one should sprinkle.

original: de nas sngon du tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor rang gi lha'i 'khor lo bton te gnas ji lta bar bzhugs su gsol nas gsungs pa'i dgug pa la sogs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa dang por bya ba dang / rang gi sngags dang / phyag rgya dang /
analyzed: de nas sngon du tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor rang gi lha'i 'khor lo bton te gnas ji lta bar bzhugs su gsol nas gsungs pa'i dgug pa la sogs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa dang por bya ba dang / rang gi sngags dang / phyag rgya dang /
translated: Then, having previously set out the mandala of the gaṇas, the wheel of one’s deity, and invited them to reside in their respective places, one should first perform the consecration of summoning and so forth.

original: lhan cig tu nye bar bltas nas dbang bskur ba dang / mchod pa dang / bstod pa dang / phyag 'tshal nas nyon mongs pa can gyi yid zhi bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin sreg byas nas phyogs su gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig tu nye bar bltas nas dbang bskur ba dang / mchod pa dang / bstod pa dang / phyag 'tshal nas nyon mongs pa can gyi yid zhi bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin sreg byas nas phyogs su gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Having seen the empowerment, offering, praise, and prostration together with one’s mantra, mudrā, and deity, one should perform the burnt offering in order to pacify the afflicted mind and give the sacrificial cake to the directions.

original: ji ltar re zhig rtsa ba'i bum pa la sogs pa'i lhag par gnas par byas nas slom ma sta gon la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar re zhig rtsa ba'i bum pa la sogs pa'i lhag par gnas par byas nas slom ma sta gon la gnas par bya'o //
translated: Having thus performed the consecration of the root vases and so forth, one should perform the consecration of the disciples.

original: h'um bzlas pa'i chus dang por snying gar gtor nas /
analyzed: h'um bzlas pa'i chus dang por snying gar gtor nas /
translated: First, having sprinkled with water enchanted with hūṃ at the heart,

original: de nyid kyis rdo rje dang bcas pa'i lag pa gzhag par bya zhing /
analyzed: de nyid kyis rdo rje dang bcas pa'i lag pa gzhag par bya zhing /
translated: one should place the hand with the vajra in the same place.

original: snying gar rdo rje rtse lnga pa dang / ji srid spyi bor sna tshogs rdo rje bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: snying gar rdo rje rtse lnga pa dang / ji srid spyi bor sna tshogs rdo rje bsam par bya'o //
translated: and a five-pronged vajra at the heart, and a variegated vajra at the crown of the head.

original: gsum @507b la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa byas te /
analyzed: gsum @507b la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa byas te /
translated: Having gone for refuge, etc.,

original: h'um gis mngon par bsngags pa'i srad bus dpung ba bcings nas so shing la sogs pa dang / dri la sogs pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: h'um gis mngon par bsngags pa'i srad bus dpung ba bcings nas so shing la sogs pa dang / dri la sogs pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: one should bind the thread, which is consecrated with the syllable hūṃ, around the upper arm, and give the tooth stick, etc., and the scents, etc.

original: de rnams la chos bstan cing dkyil 'khor gyi gnas su gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams la chos bstan cing dkyil 'khor gyi gnas su gzhug par bya ste /
translated: One should teach the Dharma to them, and cause them to enter the site of the maṇḍala.

original: de'i 'od zer rnams kyis gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'od zer rnams kyis gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: One should request the Buddhas to depart with those light rays.

original: sngar bzhin gyis yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mchod pa la sogs pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: sngar bzhin gyis yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mchod pa la sogs pa byed pa ste /
translated: “Having become transformed as before” means having made offerings, etc.

original: ji ltar 'di skad du lha'i 'khor lo ston pa de bzhin du lha'i 'khor lo der nang du bsgom par bya zhes bya ba ji snyed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di skad du lha'i 'khor lo ston pa de bzhin du lha'i 'khor lo der nang du bsgom par bya zhes bya ba ji snyed pa'o //
translated: Just as it is said that one should visualize the wheel of the deities, so one should meditate on that wheel of the deities internally.

original: gzhan yang dang por rtog pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa thugs ka nas bton nas sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi srad bu lnga po de'i bdag nyid du byas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dang por rtog pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa thugs ka nas bton nas sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi srad bu lnga po de'i bdag nyid du byas te /
translated: Furthermore, first, endowed with the yoga of imagination, one should recite the mantra of Akṣobhya and so forth, and having extracted them from the heart, one should transform them into the nature of the five colored threads, blue and so forth.🔽One should slowly transform the hūṃ and recite that hūṃ one hundred and eight times.

original: h'um dal gyis bsgyur zhing h'um de brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas par bya'o; ;de ltar rdul tshon kyang rnal 'byor 'di nyid du gzhug pa gsungs la /
analyzed: h'um dal gyis bsgyur zhing h'um de brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas par bya'o; ;de ltar rdul tshon kyang rnal 'byor 'di nyid du gzhug pa gsungs la /
translated: Thus, it is said that one should also engage in this yoga with the colored powders.

original: sangs rgyas lngas byin gyis brlabs nas dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs ji lta bar thig gdab ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas lngas byin gyis brlabs nas dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs ji lta bar thig gdab ste /
translated: Having blessed them with the five buddhas, one should draw the lines in the directions of the maṇḍala.

original: dang por slob dpon gyis rdul tshon bri bar bya zhing /
analyzed: dang por slob dpon gyis rdul tshon bri bar bya zhing /
translated: First, the master should draw the colored powders,

original: phyis ni slob mas dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du sngon po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ljang gu dang / ser po'i rdul tshon rnam pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: phyis ni slob mas dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du sngon po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ljang gu dang / ser po'i rdul tshon rnam pa lnga pa'o //
translated: and later the disciples should draw the five types of colored powders, blue, red, white, green, and yellow, outside the maṇḍala.

original: gnyis pa la ni sngon po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang gsum mo //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni sngon po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang gsum mo //
translated: In the second, there are three: blue, red, and white.

original: 'khor lo'i ni rdul tshon dkar pos 'khor lo'i lte ba sna tshogs 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs padmar bzhugs pa'i @508a *//
analyzed: 'khor lo'i ni rdul tshon dkar pos 'khor lo'i lte ba sna tshogs 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs padmar bzhugs pa'i @508a *//
translated: The wheel is with white sand, and in the center of the wheel is the so-called “diverse blazing” which is a diverse lotus.

original: rnam par snang mdzad chen po bzhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad chen po bzhugs par bya'o //
translated: One should install Great Vairocana.

original: shar la sogs pa'i re'u mig rnams su ni rtag pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i re'u mig rnams su ni rtag pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: In the squares beginning with the east, etc., are Stavaraja, etc.

original: phyogs su'o // 'khor lo'i shar la sogs pa'i mtshams rnams su spyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs su'o // 'khor lo'i shar la sogs pa'i mtshams rnams su spyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the directions, and in the east, etc., of the wheel’s circumference are Locana, etc.

original: 'phar ma gnyis pa'i shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su drag mo la sogs pa'i rdo rje lha mo rnams so //
analyzed: 'phar ma gnyis pa'i shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su drag mo la sogs pa'i rdo rje lha mo rnams so //
translated: In the east, etc., of the second tier are the Vajra goddesses Rudra, etc.

original: 'phar ma gsum pa'i shar la sogs pa'i snam bu la byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la sogs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'phar ma gsum pa'i shar la sogs pa'i snam bu la byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la sogs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the east, etc., of the third tier one should draw the Bodhisattvas Maitreya, etc.

original: shar gyi sgor rdo rje lcags kyu ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shar gyi sgor rdo rje lcags kyu ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: At the east gate, etc., are Vajra-ankusa, etc.

original: mtshams rnams ni mur dza la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams rnams ni mur dza la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the intermediate directions are Murja, etc.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw the mandala in this way.

original: ji ltar re zhig bum pa legs par byas nas brgya rtsa  rgyad bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar re zhig bum pa legs par byas nas brgya rtsa  rgyad bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Having well prepared the vase, one should consecrate it with one hundred and eight recitations.

original: rtsa ba'i bum pa la ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'o //🔽bzhi pa la ni spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhi po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i bum pa la ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'o // bzhi pa la ni spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhi po rnams kyis so //
translated: In the root vase, the lord of the mandala.🔽In the fourth, the four goddesses such as Locanā.

original: lha thams cad kyi rigs kyi dbye bas ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: lha thams cad kyi rigs kyi dbye bas ni bzhi'o //
translated: By the division of the families of all the deities, there are four.

original: de nas bum pa sgor gnas pa la las thams cad pa bzlas pas bsang gtor bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bum pa sgor gnas pa la las thams cad pa bzlas pas bsang gtor bya'o //
translated: Then, having consecrated the vase placed at the door with the all-activity mantra, one should sprinkle.

original: de rnams gos la sogs pas brgyan par byas /
analyzed: de rnams gos la sogs pas brgyan par byas /
translated: Those should be adorned with cloth, etc.

original: bdag po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas legs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis lha thams cad kyi 'khor lo rang gi bdag nyid kyi nang du bsgom par bya zhing /
analyzed: bdag po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas legs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis lha thams cad kyi 'khor lo rang gi bdag nyid kyi nang du bsgom par bya zhing /
translated: Endowed with the lord yoga, with the yoga of excellence, one should meditate on the wheel of all the deities within one's own self.

original: de'i nga rgyal dang ldan bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i nga rgyal dang ldan bar bya'o //
translated: One should possess the pride of that.

original: mchod yon gyi nye bar spyod pa yongs su bzlas nas sgo mngon par phye ste /
analyzed: mchod yon gyi nye bar spyod pa yongs su bzlas nas sgo mngon par phye ste /
translated: Having recited the offering-water practice, one should open the door.

original: gnas ji lta bar bum pa la sogs pa @508b rnams bzhag la /
analyzed: gnas ji lta bar bum pa la sogs pa @508b rnams bzhag la /
translated: Having placed the vases, etc., in their proper places,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams snga ma bzhin du phyung nas rang gi gnas su 'khor lo gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams snga ma bzhin du phyung nas rang gi gnas su 'khor lo gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Having extracted the mandala deities as before, one should install the wheel in one's own place.

original: rang gi lha'i phyag rgya rnams kyis byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir rang gi phyag rgya rab tu bstan pas rang gi dbang gis dbang bskur ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas par bsams nas /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i phyag rgya rnams kyis byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir rang gi phyag rgya rab tu bstan pas rang gi dbang gis dbang bskur ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas par bsams nas /
translated: In order to consecrate one's own deity's seal, one should visualize oneself abiding in the samadhi of consecration by one's own seal, through the revelation of one's own seal.

original: sgeg mo la sogs pa'i mchod pa rnams kyis mchod pa dang / rnga dang / gling bu la sogs pa'i yid du 'ong ba'i rang gi mchod pa'i khyad par byin gyis brlabs pa'i rig mas thal mo sbyar bas rdo rje'i glu legs par sbyar ba gsum du brjod pas phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: sgeg mo la sogs pa'i mchod pa rnams kyis mchod pa dang / rnga dang / gling bu la sogs pa'i yid du 'ong ba'i rang gi mchod pa'i khyad par byin gyis brlabs pa'i rig mas thal mo sbyar bas rdo rje'i glu legs par sbyar ba gsum du brjod pas phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Having worshipped with the offerings of the goddesses such as Lalita, and having praised with the vajra song well-composed by the goddesses who consecrate one's own special offerings such as the drum, flute, etc., which are pleasing to the mind,

original: tshim par bya ba'i don du gsungs pa'i sbyin sreg byas nas de nas bzod pa gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshim par bya ba'i don du gsungs pa'i sbyin sreg byas nas de nas bzod pa gsol bar bya'o //
translated: one should request forbearance with the request for forbearance, having performed the burnt offering which is stated for the purpose of satiation.

original: dngos grub thams cad kyi don du rang gis gsol ba btab nas dang po la sogs pas bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad kyi don du rang gis gsol ba btab nas dang po la sogs pas bskyed par bya ste /
translated: Having supplicated for the sake of all powers, one should generate the deity with the first [mantra] and so forth.

original: slob ma la sna tshogs pas brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma la sna tshogs pas brgyan par bya'o //
translated: One should adorn the disciples with the various [mantras].

original: aom la sogs pas snying gar sku la sogs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyag rgyas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: aom la sogs pas snying gar sku la sogs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyag rgyas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: With the [mantra] beginning with oṃ, one should consecrate with the seal of the consecration of body and so forth at the heart.

original: thal mo sbyar ba sdigs mdzub bsdigs pa'i 'khor lo'i rnam pas h'um brjod cing gnas lnga po thams cad du byas te /🔽gdong gos kyis bkab nas rdo rje lha mo la sogs pa'i phyag rgyas bzung ba'i me tog dang / h'um nyid kyis gzhug cing spyi'i cho gas bya'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba sdigs mdzub bsdigs pa'i 'khor lo'i rnam pas h'um brjod cing gnas lnga po thams cad du byas te / gdong gos kyis bkab nas rdo rje lha mo la sogs pa'i phyag rgyas bzung ba'i me tog dang / h'um nyid kyis gzhug cing spyi'i cho gas bya'o //
translated: Having joined the palms together, one should threaten with the index finger, and with the form of a wheel, one should say hūṃ and do it at all five places.🔽Having covered the face with a cloth, one should enter with the flower held with the seal of the goddess and so forth, and with hūṃ itself, and one should do it with the general rite.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas byin gyis brlabs nas dri dang / me tog la sogs pas brgyan par bya ste /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas byin gyis brlabs nas dri dang / me tog la sogs pas brgyan par bya ste /
translated: Having consecrated with the yoga of Śrī Vajrasattva, one should adorn with scent, flowers, and so forth.

original: ji lta bar bum pa thams cad kyis dbang bskur @509a *//
analyzed: ji lta bar bum pa thams cad kyis dbang bskur @509a *//
translated: One should confer empowerment with all the vases, just as [it is done].

original: bar bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mchod yon dang / phyag na bum pa bdud rtsi bzang pos ba kang bas de rnams kyis dbang bskur bar blta bar bya'o; ;gzhan yang /
analyzed: bar bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mchod yon dang / phyag na bum pa bdud rtsi bzang pos ba kang bas de rnams kyis dbang bskur bar blta bar bya'o; ;gzhan yang /
translated: The offerings and the nectar-filled vases held in the hands of the tathāgatas should be seen as conferring empowerment upon them.

original: gos la sogs pa rnams kyis brgyan te /
analyzed: gos la sogs pa rnams kyis brgyan te /
translated: Moreover, they are adorned with the garments and so forth.

original: rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyis dbang bskur bar gyur pa dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa du ma'i gzugs yongs su gyur pa'i nye bar thod pa dang / phreng ba dang / rdo rje dang / bdag po dang / rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur ba dang /
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyis dbang bskur bar gyur pa dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa du ma'i gzugs yongs su gyur pa'i nye bar thod pa dang / phreng ba dang / rdo rje dang / bdag po dang / rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur ba dang /
translated: They are empowered with the vajra and so forth, and they become the nature of Akṣobhya and so forth, and they are empowered with the close-essence-mantra, the garland, the vajra, the name, and the master.

original: gser la sogs pa'i thur mas mi shes pa'i rab rib bsal ba dang / me long blangs te rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad kyis mtshan nyid rnams bsgrag par bya'o //
analyzed: gser la sogs pa'i thur mas mi shes pa'i rab rib bsal ba dang / me long blangs te rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad kyis mtshan nyid rnams bsgrag par bya'o //
translated: The eye of wisdom is opened with a golden scalpel and so forth, and the characteristics are proclaimed with the verse “Taking up the mirror, the nature of Vajrasattva” and so forth.

original: dbyangs kyi dang pos glegs bam dang / dang po'i rjes kyi dbyangs kyis rdo rje dril bu dang / bka'i gnang ba sbyin pa'i don du rkang pa byin gyis brlab cing /
analyzed: dbyangs kyi dang pos glegs bam dang / dang po'i rjes kyi dbyangs kyis rdo rje dril bu dang / bka'i gnang ba sbyin pa'i don du rkang pa byin gyis brlab cing /
translated: With the first vowel [a], the book; with the vowel following the first [ā], the vajra and bell; and with the consecration of the feet for the purpose of giving the permission,

original: lag pa g-yas pas ral gri sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pas ral gri sbyin par bya ste /
translated: one should give the sword with the right hand.

original: de nas bzung ste 'jig rten la chos kyi 'khor lo skor cig /
analyzed: de nas bzung ste 'jig rten la chos kyi 'khor lo skor cig /
translated: Then, one should say, Turn the wheel of Dharma for the world.

original: skyob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang dag par dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: skyob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang dag par dmigs par bya'o //
translated: One should also visualize the protector and so forth.

original: de ring nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dam tshig nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: de ring nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dam tshig nye bar bstan nas /
translated: From today onward and so forth indicates the commitments.

original: bla mas yon blangs nas zhi ba'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: bla mas yon blangs nas zhi ba'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Having taken the fee from the disciple, one should perform the fire sacrifice of peace.

original: mchod pa dang bstod pa la sogs pa byas nas h'um zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa dang bstod pa la sogs pa byas nas h'um zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having made offerings, praises, and so forth, one should say hūṃ.

original: svtva badzra mu: zhes bya bas lha'i 'khor @509b aom  gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: svtva badzra mu: zhes bya bas lha'i 'khor @509b aom  gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: With svāhā vajra muḥ, one should request the departure of the deity circle.

original: phur pa bton nas de bzhin du gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid gong du gsungs pa'i lag pa nyid kyis gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: phur pa bton nas de bzhin du gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid gong du gsungs pa'i lag pa nyid kyis gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: Having extracted the kila, one should request the departure of the secret mandala with the same hand as before.

original: dza: h'um bam ho: zhes brjod bas rang gnas nyid du khyad par 'phags par nang du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: zhes brjod bas rang gnas nyid du khyad par 'phags par nang du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Saying jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, one should imagine that [the deities] depart to their own places.

original: h'um nyid kyis rdul tshon dbye bar bya zhing bsdus nas chu'i nang du blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: h'um nyid kyis rdul tshon dbye bar bya zhing bsdus nas chu'i nang du blugs par bya'o //
translated: With the syllable hūṃ one should gather up the colored powders and pour them into the water.

original: khro bos khro bo gzung ba'i phyir dpal he ru ka 'byung ba bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: khro bos khro bo gzung ba'i phyir dpal he ru ka 'byung ba bka' stsal pa /
translated: The glorious Heruka has declared the origin of Heruka in order to grasp the wrathful with wrath.🔽The Blessed One is a yogin, and so forth. The glorious Vajrasattva is called the first yogin by the sons of the lineage.

original: de nyid bcom ldan rnal 'byor te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' dang po'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi bu bsgrags pa yin no; ;srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba bcu la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan rnal 'byor te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' dang po'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi bu bsgrags pa yin no; ;srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba bcu la spyod pa dang /
translated: Those who engage in the ten non-virtues such as killing,

original: dam tshig nyams pa de rnams kyis rnam par dag pa brjod de /
analyzed: dam tshig nyams pa de rnams kyis rnam par dag pa brjod de /
translated: and those who have transgressed their commitments, they all declare their purity.

original: rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni dag pa'o //
translated: Purity is called purity.

original: sgeg cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ro dang ldan pa dang / zhal brgyad pa la zhabs bzhi pa /
analyzed: sgeg cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ro dang ldan pa dang / zhal brgyad pa la zhabs bzhi pa /
translated: The eight faces have four feet.

original: phyag ni bcu drug dag gis brgyan //
analyzed: phyag ni bcu drug dag gis brgyan //
translated: It is adorned with sixteen arms.

original: spyan ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi par //
analyzed: spyan ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi par //
translated: It has twenty-four eyes.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One has taught this.

original: yang de ltar rim pa des bcom ldan 'das zhal bzhi pa /
analyzed: yang de ltar rim pa des bcom ldan 'das zhal bzhi pa /
translated: Again, in that way, the Blessed One has four faces.

original: phyag bzhi yis ni rnam par spras pa'o //
analyzed: phyag bzhi yis ni rnam par spras pa'o //
translated: It is adorned with four arms.

original: de la zhal dang po ni drag po'o //
analyzed: de la zhal dang po ni drag po'o //
translated: There, the first face is wrathful.

original: gnyis pa g-yas pa ni bde bas rab tu myos shing 'jigs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa g-yas pa ni bde bas rab tu myos shing 'jigs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The second, right face is terrifying, intoxicated with bliss.

original: rgyab tu zhal gsum pa la ni rmad du byung ba'i bza' ba'o //
analyzed: rgyab tu zhal gsum pa la ni rmad du byung ba'i bza' ba'o //
translated: The third face, in the back, is of wondrous food.

original: g-yon du zhal sgeg pas 'o mdzad pa'o //🔽de bzhin du steng ma'i zhal gtsigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par @510a *//
analyzed: g-yon du zhal sgeg pas 'o mdzad pa'o // de bzhin du steng ma'i zhal gtsigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par @510a *//
translated: The left face is charming, kissing.

original: mdzad pa'i mchog go /
analyzed: mdzad pa'i mchog go /
translated: Similarly, the upper face is called frowning, which is the supreme expression.

original: zhal gsum ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhal gsum ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The three faces are the wisdoms of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: mi bskyod pa'i gzugs can gyi rdo rje can ni de bzhin du phyag drug pa'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i gzugs can gyi rdo rje can ni de bzhin du phyag drug pa'o //
translated: The Vajra Holder with the form of Akṣobhya is likewise six-faced.

original: rgyas par 'byung ba ni phyag gnyis pa la zhal gcig par yang bstan par bya zhing g-yon pa'i phrag par ni mchod phyir dag pa'i sbyor bas rdo rje dang / dril bu dang bcas pas kha tv'am ga gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas par 'byung ba ni phyag gnyis pa la zhal gcig par yang bstan par bya zhing g-yon pa'i phrag par ni mchod phyir dag pa'i sbyor bas rdo rje dang / dril bu dang bcas pas kha tv'am ga gnas pa'o //
translated: The extensive form should be taught as having two arms and one face, and the vajra and bell are placed on the left shoulder, with the katvanga in between, in the manner of worship.

original: de'i phyag g-yas pa ba dan rtse gsum pa dang ldan pa dang / rdo rje so tsi ka dang / 'bar ba'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de'i phyag g-yas pa ba dan rtse gsum pa dang ldan pa dang / rdo rje so tsi ka dang / 'bar ba'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: His right hands hold a banner with three points, a vajra hook, and a blazing wheel.

original: phyag g-yon pa la thod pa snying rje chen pos gang ba yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa la thod pa snying rje chen pos gang ba yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The left hands hold a skull-cup filled with great compassion.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i phyed krung gis za ba zhes bya ba ni stan mthon po la 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i phyed krung gis za ba zhes bya ba ni stan mthon po la 'dug pa ste /
translated: The half-vajra posture is sitting on a high seat.

original: rkang pa g-yon pa sa la bzhag par bya ste /🔽de'i brla g-yas pa'i rkang pas sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis sbyor bas dgod do //
analyzed: rkang pa g-yon pa sa la bzhag par bya ste /🔽de'i brla g-yas pa'i rkang pas sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis sbyor bas dgod do //
translated: The left foot should be placed on the ground.🔽The right thigh is placed on the left foot, in the posture of the hero.

original: de'i rkang pa'i mthil gyis yang g-yon pa'i brla mnyam par sbyor bar byed pa'i sbyor bas mnan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rkang pa'i mthil gyis yang g-yon pa'i brla mnyam par sbyor bar byed pa'i sbyor bas mnan par bya'o //
translated: With the sole of his foot, he presses down on the left thigh, in union with the same level of the left foot.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi drag po'i gdan la bzhugs pa'i skyil mo krung gis phyag rgya 'dis bsgrub par bya ba rab tu thob par 'gyur te /🔽g-yon pa'i brla rkang pa'i dgod pas mnyam par sbyor bar byed pas phye mar byas nas rab tu rgyas par khro bo'i sku de ni zhal steng du bsams nas /
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi drag po'i gdan la bzhugs pa'i skyil mo krung gis phyag rgya 'dis bsgrub par bya ba rab tu thob par 'gyur te / g-yon pa'i brla rkang pa'i dgod pas mnyam par sbyor bar byed pas phye mar byas nas rab tu rgyas par khro bo'i sku de ni zhal steng du bsams nas /
translated: this is the mudrā of the sitting posture of the wrathful Bhagavān.🔽With the left foot placed on the right foot, he is pulverized, and the body of the wrathful one expands.

original: des bsgrub par bya ba btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: des bsgrub par bya ba btung bar bya'o //
translated: One should imagine his face above one’s own, and the one to be subdued should drink.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal steng du bsgom par bya zhing /
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal steng du bsgom par bya zhing /
translated: One should visualize him above the face of the Bhagavān.

original: @510b zhabs g-yas pas de bzhin du rdo rje skyil mo krung gi sbyor bas bud med thams cad ji ltar 'dod par blangs nas /
analyzed: @510b zhabs g-yas pas de bzhin du rdo rje skyil mo krung gi sbyor bas bud med thams cad ji ltar 'dod par blangs nas /
translated: With the right foot in the same way, in the posture of the vajra seat, one should take all women as one wishes.

original: brla g-yon pa bskyod bas de rnams dang mnyam bar sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: brla g-yon pa bskyod bas de rnams dang mnyam bar sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: With the left thigh moving, one should unite with them.

original: yang na zhal gyi phyag rgya bsgrags par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na zhal gyi phyag rgya bsgrags par bya ste /
translated: Or else, one should proclaim the seal of the face.

original: shar gyi re'u mig la ni dkar mo'i gdong zhi ba'o //
analyzed: shar gyi re'u mig la ni dkar mo'i gdong zhi ba'o //
translated: In the eastern square is the face of white Gaurī, peaceful.

original: g-yas su chom rkun ma'i gdong ni drag mo'o //🔽rgyab tu rab tu rmongs ma'i ni bde ba'i myos byed kyis rab tu rmongs ma'i gdong ngo //
analyzed: g-yas su chom rkun ma'i gdong ni drag mo'o // rgyab tu rab tu rmongs ma'i ni bde ba'i myos byed kyis rab tu rmongs ma'i gdong ngo //
translated: To the right, in the southern square, is the face of Caṇḍālī, fierce.🔽In the rear, in the western square, is the face of Pukkasī, intoxicated with bliss.

original: g-yon du ro langs ma'i gdong ma'o //
analyzed: g-yon du ro langs ma'i gdong ma'o //
translated: To the left, in the northern square, is the face of Ḍombinī.

original: me'i re'u mig la pukka s'i ni gar gyi gdong ma'o //
analyzed: me'i re'u mig la pukka s'i ni gar gyi gdong ma'o //
translated: In the southeast square is the face of Pukkasi, dancing.

original: bden bral gyi re'u mig la ni gdol pa mo gzhan gyi srog 'phrog pa'i sbyor bas thams cad du gus pa dang bcas pa'i gdong ma'o //
analyzed: bden bral gyi re'u mig la ni gdol pa mo gzhan gyi srog 'phrog pa'i sbyor bas thams cad du gus pa dang bcas pa'i gdong ma'o //
translated: In the southwest square is the face of Caṇḍālī, devoted to all through the practice of taking the life of others.

original: rlung du ghasma r'i shi ba za ba'i gdong ma'o //
analyzed: rlung du ghasma r'i shi ba za ba'i gdong ma'o //
translated: In the northwest square is the face of Ḍombinī, eating the dead.

original: dbang ldan du he ru ka lta bur bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs can ma'o //🔽dkar mo ni zhi pa'i lta stangs so //
analyzed: dbang ldan du he ru ka lta bur bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs can ma'o // dkar mo ni zhi pa'i lta stangs so //
translated: In the northeast square is the face of Ghasmarī, the form of the Blessed One like Heruka.🔽Gaurī has a peaceful gaze.🔽Caṇḍālī has a fierce gaze.

original: chom rkun ma ni drag mo'i lta stangs so //🔽rab tu rmongs ma ni rab tu rmongs pa'i lta stangs so //
analyzed: chom rkun ma ni drag mo'i lta stangs so //🔽rab tu rmongs ma ni rab tu rmongs pa'i lta stangs so //
translated: Pukkasī has a gaze of intoxication.

original: ro langs ma ni shi ba slong ba'i lta stangs so //
analyzed: ro langs ma ni shi ba slong ba'i lta stangs so //
translated: The Vetāla-mudrā is the gaze of the dead.🔽The Pukkasī-mudrā is the gaze of the dance.

original: pukka s'i ni gar gyi lta stangs so; ;gdol pa mo ni steng du lta ba'o //
analyzed: pukka s'i ni gar gyi lta stangs so; ;gdol pa mo ni steng du lta ba'o //
translated: The Caṇḍālī-mudrā is the upward gaze.

original: ghasma r'i ni gdan du lta ba'o //
analyzed: ghasma r'i ni gdan du lta ba'o //
translated: The Dombī-mudrā is the gaze of the seat.

original: me tog la dkar mo'i gzugs su bsams nas /
analyzed: me tog la dkar mo'i gzugs su bsams nas /
translated: Having visualized the form of the goddess Puṣpā,

original: gang la byin pa de phyag rgyas 'debs par 'gyur ro //🔽bdug pa la ni chom rkun ma'i gzugs so //
analyzed: gang la byin pa de phyag rgyas 'debs par 'gyur ro // bdug pa la ni chom rkun ma'i gzugs so //
translated: one should seal with the mudrā the one to whom it is given.🔽In the case of incense, one should visualize the form of the Caṇḍālī.

original: chang la ni rab tu rmongs ma'i gzugs so //
analyzed: chang la ni rab tu rmongs ma'i gzugs so //
translated: In the case of wine, one should visualize the form of the Mahāmāṃsā.

original: chu la ni ro langs ma'i gzugs so //🔽shing gi 'khril shing zla ni pukka s'i'o //
analyzed: chu la ni ro langs ma'i gzugs so // shing gi 'khril shing zla ni pukka s'i'o //
translated: In the case of water, one should visualize the form of the Vetālī.🔽In the case of a creeper, one should visualize the form of the Pukkasī.

original: ras la ni gtum mo'o //🔽me la ni @511a *//
analyzed: ras la ni gtum mo'o // me la ni @511a *//
translated: In the case of cloth, one should visualize the form of the Caṇḍālī.

original: ghasma r'i ste /
analyzed: ghasma r'i ste /
translated: In the case of fire, one should visualize the form of the Ghasmarī.

original: rtse gcig pa'i mnyam par sbyor ba'i bsam gtan gyi sbyor bas kun tu gnas so //
analyzed: rtse gcig pa'i mnyam par sbyor ba'i bsam gtan gyi sbyor bas kun tu gnas so //
translated: One should abide in the union of one-pointed concentration through the practice of meditative concentration.

original: de nas dkar mo de'i bsam gtan gyis kyang phyag rgyas gdab bar bya'o zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nas dkar mo de'i bsam gtan gyis kyang phyag rgyas gdab bar bya'o zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Then, with the meditative concentration of Puṣpā, one should also seal with the mudrā.

original: de ltar bya ba chom rkun mas snying ga nas drangs pa'i bsam gtan gyis bsgrub bya'i lus la zhugs te snying nas drang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar bya ba chom rkun mas snying ga nas drangs pa'i bsam gtan gyis bsgrub bya'i lus la zhugs te snying nas drang ngo //
translated: Thus, the object to be accomplished is penetrated by the meditation of the thief, drawn from the heart.

original: rab tu rmongs pa'i sbyor bas bde bas rmongs shing bsgrub bya rmongs par bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: rab tu rmongs pa'i sbyor bas bde bas rmongs shing bsgrub bya rmongs par bsam par bya ste /
translated: One should imagine that the object to be accomplished is stupefied by the bliss of the practice of the extremely confused one.

original: de ltar bde ba rab tu sbyin pas rab tu rmongs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bde ba rab tu sbyin pas rab tu rmongs par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, one is confused by the bestowal of bliss.

original: ro langs ma'i bsam gtan gyis bdud rtsi chu yis gtor bas shi ba slong bar byed do //
analyzed: ro langs ma'i bsam gtan gyis bdud rtsi chu yis gtor bas shi ba slong bar byed do //
translated: By the meditation of the zombie, one revives the dead by sprinkling them with the water of nectar.

original: pukka s'i'i rnal 'byor gyis se gol gtogs pas gar byed do //
analyzed: pukka s'i'i rnal 'byor gyis se gol gtogs pas gar byed do //
translated: By the yoga of Pukkasī, one makes dance by snapping one’s fingers.

original: steng du shin tu dbugs kyi bsam gtan gyis lhan cig gcig tu gyur pas gdol pa mos gsod par byed do //
analyzed: steng du shin tu dbugs kyi bsam gtan gyis lhan cig gcig tu gyur pas gdol pa mos gsod par byed do //
translated: By the meditation of the extremely confused one above, the caṇḍālī kills by becoming one with the object to be accomplished.

original: gdan gyi bza' bas ghasma r'i'i bsam gtan des bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: gdan gyi bza' bas ghasma r'i'i bsam gtan des bza' bar bya'o //
translated: By the meditation of Ghasmarī, one should eat the food of the seat.

original: dkar mos ni g-yon gyi sta stangs kyis bsgrub bya la bltas pas phyag rgyas 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: dkar mos ni g-yon gyi sta stangs kyis bsgrub bya la bltas pas phyag rgyas 'debs par byed do //
translated: By the white one, one seals the object to be accomplished by looking with the left-hand gaze.

original: yid kyis bsgrub bya'i snying gar zhugs te //
analyzed: yid kyis bsgrub bya'i snying gar zhugs te //
translated: With the mind, he enters the heart of the victim,

original: de'i snying gi padma lag pa g-yon pas 'don cing 'gugs par byed do //
