analyzed: de'i snying gi padma lag pa g-yon pas 'don cing 'gugs par byed do //
translated: and with his left hand plucks out the lotus of his heart and draws it out.

original: chom rkun mas ni snying nas 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: chom rkun mas ni snying nas 'dren par byed do //
translated: With the Caṇḍālī, he draws out the heart.

original: rab tu rmongs mas ni yid kyis sam mngon sum du'o //
analyzed: rab tu rmongs mas ni yid kyis sam mngon sum du'o //
translated: With the Pukkasi, he maddens the mind, either by the mind or in person.

original: byed pas bde bas rab tu rmongs par byed do //🔽ro langs ma ni yid kyis sam /
analyzed: byed pas bde bas rab tu rmongs par byed do // ro langs ma ni yid kyis sam /
translated: With the Ḍombinī, he maddens the mind with bliss.

original: mngon sum du 'khyud nas 'chi ba slong bar byed do //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'khyud nas 'chi ba slong bar byed do //
translated: With the Śavarī, he revives the dead, either by the mind or in person.

original: @511b pukka s'i'i rnal 'byor gyis gar byed pa ni yi kyis bsgrub bya dang lhan cig gcig tu gyur pas rang gis gar byed do //
analyzed: @511b pukka s'i'i rnal 'byor gyis gar byed pa ni yi kyis bsgrub bya dang lhan cig gcig tu gyur pas rang gis gar byed do //
translated: With the dance of the yoga of the Pukkasī, he becomes one with the victim and dances by himself.

original: yid kyis bsgrub bya dang lhan cig gcig tu gyur pas bde bas rmongs pa'i steng gi lta stangs byas te /🔽gtum mo'i rnal 'byor gyis gsod par byed do //
analyzed: yid kyis bsgrub bya dang lhan cig gcig tu gyur pas bde bas rmongs pa'i steng gi lta stangs byas te / gtum mo'i rnal 'byor gyis gsod par byed do //
translated: With the yoga of the Caṇḍālī, he looks at the victim with a gaze of bliss and maddens the mind.🔽With the yoga of the Ḍombinī, he kills the victim.

original: ghasma r'i'i rnal 'byor gyis bsgrub bya khar bcug ste bca' zhing bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: ghasma r'i'i rnal 'byor gyis bsgrub bya khar bcug ste bca' zhing bza' bar bya'o //
translated: With the yoga of the Śavarī, he puts the victim in his mouth and chews and eats him.

original: bza' bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni dgra bo thams cad shin tu rtag tu zos pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni dgra bo thams cad shin tu rtag tu zos pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase what is to be eaten means that all enemies are to be eaten, always and forever.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad la ni 'jig rten gsum sgrol ba zhes bya ba'i ming rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad la ni 'jig rten gsum sgrol ba zhes bya ba'i ming rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: Vajra Humkara obtains the name Liberator of the Three Worlds.

original: de ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba yin no //
translated: He is Vajrasattva, the Victorious One over the Three Worlds.

original: de nas gzhan du zhes bya ba ni mdzes pa dang / snying rje'i stobs la sogs pa'i khro bo gzhan thams cad khro bo'i ro gcig par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de nas gzhan du zhes bya ba ni mdzes pa dang / snying rje'i stobs la sogs pa'i khro bo gzhan thams cad khro bo'i ro gcig par zhen pa'o //
translated: Then, otherwise means that all other wrathful ones, such as Sumbha and Karunshakti, are of one taste with the wrathful one.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavat,

original: khro bo'i gzugs kyi mtshan ci lags /
analyzed: khro bo'i gzugs kyi mtshan ci lags /
translated: what is the characteristic of the wrathful form?

original: gang gi don du gsungs /
analyzed: gang gi don du gsungs /
translated: For what purpose is it taught?

original: lus la dam par lta ba dang / srog dang / gang zag la sogs pa bdag tu 'dzin pas smras pa dang / rtag pa thams cad kyi mthar byed pa gshin rje'i rgyal po ste /
analyzed: lus la dam par lta ba dang / srog dang / gang zag la sogs pa bdag tu 'dzin pas smras pa dang / rtag pa thams cad kyi mthar byed pa gshin rje'i rgyal po ste /
translated: The one who speaks with the grasping of the self of the body, life, person, and so on, and the one who brings an end to all permanence is the King of Death.

original: gsum byed pa de rnams kyis brtags pa'i 'khor lo las rgyal ba ni brtags pa thams cad kyi mchog dngos grub kyi dbang phyug yin no //
analyzed: gsum byed pa de rnams kyis brtags pa'i 'khor lo las rgyal ba ni brtags pa thams cad kyi mchog dngos grub kyi dbang phyug yin no //
translated: The one who conquers the wheel of those actions is the lord of powers, the best of all imagined [deities].

original: khro bo'i rgyal po gshin rje 'jigs byed ces bya ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po gshin rje 'jigs byed ces bya ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: The wrathful king called Slayer of Yama will be explained.

original: gang gi phyir khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Because, beginning with Vishnu and Mahesvara,

original: de @512a *// thams cad rdo rje 'jigs byed kyis thal bar brlag par mdzad do //
analyzed: de @512a *// thams cad rdo rje 'jigs byed kyis thal bar brlag par mdzad do //
translated: all of them are ground to dust by Vajrabhairava.

original: 'dod chags chen po zhes bya ba la 'dod chags chen po ni 'dod chags rdo rje ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po zhes bya ba la 'dod chags chen po ni 'dod chags rdo rje ste /
translated: Great passion is passion-vajra.

original: de'i ngo bo can ni der brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo can ni der brjod pa yin no //
translated: The one who has that nature is said to be that.

original: yang rdo rje sems dpar gyur nas 'dod chags can gyi rdo rjer 'gyur pa'i phyir dpyid lta bur me tog dri zhim pa'i phreng ba dang / snying po la sogs pas brgyan par bya ba'i phyir dang / me tog gi gzhu dang / mda' dang ldan pa'i phyir nga ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: yang rdo rje sems dpar gyur nas 'dod chags can gyi rdo rjer 'gyur pa'i phyir dpyid lta bur me tog dri zhim pa'i phreng ba dang / snying po la sogs pas brgyan par bya ba'i phyir dang / me tog gi gzhu dang / mda' dang ldan pa'i phyir nga ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Because of having a flower bow and arrow, I am passion.🔽The arrow of the three bodies is called the arrangement, which is the arrangement of the three, the mother, the syllable a, and so forth, in the center of the leaf of the bow.

original: sku gsum gyi mda' ni rnam dgod pa zhes bya ba ni spang leb kyi phub kyi dbus su yum kham dang / aom la sogs pa gsum dgod pa dang / mda' dang lhan cig btsun mo'i spyi bor rdzas 'di rnams bsam par bya zhing 'dzag pa'i don du padma'i mthar gsungs so //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi mda' ni rnam dgod pa zhes bya ba ni spang leb kyi phub kyi dbus su yum kham dang / aom la sogs pa gsum dgod pa dang / mda' dang lhan cig btsun mo'i spyi bor rdzas 'di rnams bsam par bya zhing 'dzag pa'i don du padma'i mthar gsungs so //
translated: The substances should be imagined at the crown of the queen together with the arrow for the purpose of emission at the end of the lotus.

original: gal te 'dod pa zhu ba ni 'dod pa zhu ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa zhu ba ni 'dod pa zhu ba lta bu'o //
translated: If passion melts, it is like the melting of passion.

original: padma zhes bya ba ni snying po te /
analyzed: padma zhes bya ba ni snying po te /
translated: Lotus is the heart.

original: ae bam lta bur dbang du gyur pas 'dzag pa'o //
analyzed: ae bam lta bur dbang du gyur pas 'dzag pa'o //
translated: Like e and vam, it is under control and drips.

original: 'di skad la sogs mtha' yas mchog /
analyzed: 'di skad la sogs mtha' yas mchog /
translated: This and so forth are the supreme of the infinite.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sdom pa mchog ces bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sdom pa mchog ces bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One, the Tathagata Vajra of the Body, Speech and Mind of all Tathagatas, said: This is the supreme vow of all Buddhas.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the Blessed One and the Bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi, the great being, said this to the Blessed One:

original: nyid kyi 'byung ba yang dag par bka' stsal la /
analyzed: nyid kyi 'byung ba yang dag par bka' stsal la /
translated: You have perfectly proclaimed your own origin,

original: da ni bdag la bshad du @512b gsol /
analyzed: da ni bdag la bshad du @512b gsol /
translated: now please explain to me.

original: sna tshogs bris sku bkab pa zhes bya ba ni gdan rnams su brjod de /
analyzed: sna tshogs bris sku bkab pa zhes bya ba ni gdan rnams su brjod de /
translated: The covered painted image is said to be the seats,

original: de rnams kyi yar 'jug pa ni de'i don gyi rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi yar 'jug pa ni de'i don gyi rnal 'byor te /
translated: and the entry into them is the yoga of their meaning,

original: bris sku 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: bris sku 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: the yoga of entering the painted image.

original: de bas na rang 'byung bar byed do /
analyzed: de bas na rang 'byung bar byed do /
translated: Therefore, it causes self-origination.

original: yang dag par rab tu gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The perfectly proclaimed means generated, this is the meaning.

original: padma'i snod ces bya ba 'di ni mi'i thod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i snod ces bya ba 'di ni mi'i thod par shes par bya'o //
translated: The lotus vessel should be understood as a human skull.

original: nga ni yang khyod la btsun mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbyibs bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: nga ni yang khyod la btsun mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbyibs bshad par bya ste /
translated: I will now explain to you the shape of the mandala of queens.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang ni zlum po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang ni zlum po'o //
translated: The palace of the Tathagata is round.

original: he ru ka'i zla ba phyed pa'i dbyibs zhes bya ba ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbyibs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: he ru ka'i zla ba phyed pa'i dbyibs zhes bya ba ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbyibs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The shape of the half-moon of Heruka means the shape of the wind mandala.

original: padma'i rnam pa dang / rin po che'i rnam par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i rnam pa dang / rin po che'i rnam par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know the shape of the lotus and the shape of the jewel.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dun pa'o //
translated: As one desires means as one wishes.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang / rin po che dang / ral gri'i gdan gyi dbus su sgrub pa po gang 'dod pa de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang / rin po che dang / ral gri'i gdan gyi dbus su sgrub pa po gang 'dod pa de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: Thus, in the center of the seat of the Tathagata, the vajra, the lotus, the jewel, and the sword, the practitioner should visualize the image of the Tathagata, etc., whichever he desires.

original: phyi nas rta mchog gi gzugs brnyan gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: phyi nas rta mchog gi gzugs brnyan gzhug par bya ste /
translated: After that, one should place the image of the Supreme Horse.

original: rta mchog gi dkyil 'khor du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rta mchog gi dkyil 'khor du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated in the mandala of the Supreme Horse.

original: ji ltar thob pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rnyed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar thob pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rnyed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As to how to obtain, it means how to find.

original: gang nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi yo byed skyes pa de nyid kyi yo byad kyis bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi yo byed skyes pa de nyid kyi yo byad kyis bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw the maṇḍala of the one who is born with the requisites of the one who is born.

original: dus ji lta bar zhes bya ba ni zhi bar 'dod pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gdan de bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus ji lta bar zhes bya ba ni zhi bar 'dod pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gdan de bri bar bya'o //
translated: As to in what time, it means that if one desires peace, one should draw the seat in the center of the maṇḍala of the Tathāgata.

original: rgyas pa'i don du rin po che'i dkyil 'khor la @513a *//
analyzed: rgyas pa'i don du rin po che'i dkyil 'khor la @513a *//
translated: For the purpose of increasing,

original: nyi ma shar na bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma shar na bri bar bya'o //
translated: one should draw it on a jeweled maṇḍala at sunrise.

original: mngon spyod kyi las rnams la nyi ma phyed dang / nam phyed na rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor la'o //
analyzed: mngon spyod kyi las rnams la nyi ma phyed dang / nam phyed na rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor la'o //
translated: For the rites of assault, at noon or midnight on a vajra maṇḍala.

original: gzhan pa'i las rnams la padma'i dkyil 'khor la nyi ma smyur na'o //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i las rnams la padma'i dkyil 'khor la nyi ma smyur na'o //
translated: For other rites, on a lotus maṇḍala at sunrise.

original: ji ltar bde ba zhes bya ba ni dam tshig dang / dbang la dus kyi nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bde ba zhes bya ba ni dam tshig dang / dbang la dus kyi nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: As to in whatever way, there is no restriction of time for the samaya and empowerment.

original: shar dang / lho dang / byang dang / nub kyi phyogs su thig bzhi btab pas dkyil 'khor brgyad du'o //🔽yongs su gang ba'i dbang zhes bya ba ni slob dpon thams cad do //🔽slob ma mchog 'bring tham kun zhes bya ba ni tha ma la ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbang dang / nyin bar gyi thig le'o //
analyzed: shar dang / lho dang / byang dang / nub kyi phyogs su thig bzhi btab pas dkyil 'khor brgyad du'o // yongs su gang ba'i dbang zhes bya ba ni slob dpon thams cad do // slob ma mchog 'bring tham kun zhes bya ba ni tha ma la ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbang dang / nyin bar gyi thig le'o //
translated: The eight parts are the four parts of the four directions and the four parts of the four intermediate directions.🔽 The eight corners are the four corners of the four directions and the four corners of the four intermediate directions.

original: 'bring po la ni nya phyis kyis so //🔽gang zhig mchog de rnams la ni sangs rgyas gcig pu'i bdag nyid kyis sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bring po la ni nya phyis kyis so // gang zhig mchog de rnams la ni sangs rgyas gcig pu'i bdag nyid kyis sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The eight spokes are the four spokes of the four directions and the four spokes of the four intermediate directions.🔽 The eight petals are the four petals of the four directions and the four petals of the four intermediate directions.🔽 The eight doors are the four doors of the four directions and the four doors of the four intermediate directions.🔽 The eight vases are the four vases of the four directions and the four vases of the four intermediate directions.

original: dum bu gcig pa'i mgo skyes zhes bya ba ni dum bu gcig pa dang / mgo bo'i rdo rje ni dum bu gcig pa'i mgo skyes so //
analyzed: dum bu gcig pa'i mgo skyes zhes bya ba ni dum bu gcig pa dang / mgo bo'i rdo rje ni dum bu gcig pa'i mgo skyes so //
translated: The eight lamps are the four lamps of the four directions and the four lamps of the four intermediate directions.🔽 The eight offerings are the four offerings of the four directions and the four offerings of the four intermediate directions.

original: dum bu gcig pa ni thod pa dum bu gcig pa'i bdag nyid kyis dbang yang bya'o //🔽mgo skyes zhes bya ba ni padma'i snod do //
analyzed: dum bu gcig pa ni thod pa dum bu gcig pa'i bdag nyid kyis dbang yang bya'o // mgo skyes zhes bya ba ni padma'i snod do //
translated: The eight offerings are the four offerings of the four directions and the four offerings of the four intermediate directions.🔽 The eight offerings are the four offerings of the four directions and the four offerings of the four intermediate directions.🔽 The eight offerings are the four offerings of the four directions and the four offerings of the four intermediate directions.🔽 The eight offerings are the four offerings of the four directions and the four offerings of the four intermediate directions.🔽 The eight offerings are the four offerings of the four directions and the four offerings of the four intermediate directions.🔽 The eight offerings are the four offerings of the four directions and the four offerings of the four intermediate directions.🔽 The eight offerings are the four offerings of the four directions and the four offerings of the four intermediate directions.🔽 The eight offerings are the four offerings of the four directions and the four offerings of the four intermediate directions.🔽 The eight offerings are the four offerings of the four directions and the four offerings of the four intermediate directions.

original: dum bu gcig pa ni bug pa gcig pa ste /
analyzed: dum bu gcig pa ni bug pa gcig pa ste /
translated: The eight offerings are the four offerings of the four directions and the four offerings of the four intermediate directions.

original: ma gas pa dang / ma chag pa zhes bya ba ji snyed pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ma gas pa dang / ma chag pa zhes bya ba ji snyed pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand not cracked and not broken in the same way.

original: kam ni phung po skyong bar byed pa'i phyir thod pa'o //
analyzed: kam ni phung po skyong bar byed pa'i phyir thod pa'o //
translated: Kam means skull, because it protects the aggregates.

original: de bzhin du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag nyid 'grub //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag nyid 'grub //
translated: The nature of all buddhas is accomplished.

original: padma gcig bdag de bzhin no //
analyzed: padma gcig bdag de bzhin no //
translated: The same for the single lotus.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rdo rje rin po che'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rdo rje rin po che'i dbang ngo //
translated: The consecration of the Blessed One Vairocana is the vajra consecration,

original: dpal he ru ka ni rdo rje'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka ni rdo rje'i dbang ngo //
translated: the consecration of Śrī Heruka is the vajra consecration,

original: 'od dpag tu med @513b pa'i dbang ni nor bu'i dbang dang / der bzlas par yang bya'o //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med @513b pa'i dbang ni nor bu'i dbang dang / der bzlas par yang bya'o //
translated: and the consecration of Amitābha is the jewel consecration, and one should also recite there.

original: rin po che phyed pa ni rdo rje'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: rin po che phyed pa ni rdo rje'i dbang ngo //
translated: The half-jewel is the vajra consecration.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku ni nor bu'i dbang du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku ni nor bu'i dbang du shes par bya'o //
translated: The body of all buddhas should be known as the jewel consecration.

original: rta mchog gi yang ngo //
analyzed: rta mchog gi yang ngo //
translated: The same for Hayagrīva.

original: rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyis mi bskyod pa ni rdo rje sems dpar yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyis mi bskyod pa ni rdo rje sems dpar yang shes par bya'o //
translated: By the nature of cause and effect, Akṣobhya should be known as Vajrasattva.

original: thod pa'i gdan 'di'i 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: thod pa'i gdan 'di'i 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is to be accomplished by the effort of this skull seat?

original: rang bzhin nyid de'i 'grub pa rab tu 'byung bas rang bzhin las rab tu 'byung ba'i nus pas gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa skabs med pa'i ngo bo'i phyir de nyid du gyur pa'i rab tu byung bas de'i rang bzhin gyis grub pa'o //🔽thod pa'i phreng ba'i rgyan gyi gzugs kyi rang bzhin las zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes las de ltar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid de'i 'grub pa rab tu 'byung bas rang bzhin las rab tu 'byung ba'i nus pas gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa skabs med pa'i ngo bo'i phyir de nyid du gyur pa'i rab tu byung bas de'i rang bzhin gyis grub pa'o // thod pa'i phreng ba'i rgyan gyi gzugs kyi rang bzhin las zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes las de ltar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.

original: dper na / me ni tsha ba'i rang bzhin du grub pa ste /
analyzed: dper na / me ni tsha ba'i rang bzhin du grub pa ste /
translated: Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.🔽Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.🔽Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.🔽Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.🔽Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.🔽Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.🔽Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.🔽Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.🔽Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.🔽Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.🔽Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.🔽Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.🔽Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.🔽Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.🔽Since the nature is the origination by the power of origination, the nature is established as the origination.

original: de ltar de'i yang rab tu 'byung ba nyid las rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'i phyir de nyid kyi bzang po'i bsam pa'i rnal 'byor byas na ye shes sems dpa' dang lhan cig gcig pa'i dngos pos de ltar gyur pa'i rnal 'byor gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams🔽cad kyi rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de'i yang rab tu 'byung ba nyid las rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'i phyir de nyid kyi bzang po'i bsam pa'i rnal 'byor byas na ye shes sems dpa' dang lhan cig gcig pa'i dngos pos de ltar gyur pa'i rnal 'byor gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams🔽cad kyi rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Since the nature is the origination by the power

original: rang gi snying ga'i zla bar h'um blos bris nas de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i zla bar h'um blos bris nas de brjod par bya ste /
translated: One should write the syllable hūṃ on the moon at one’s heart, and recite it.

original: bdag nyid nam mkha' dang mnyam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid nam mkha' dang mnyam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine oneself equal to space.

original: de nyid kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid do //
translated: That very moon disk in the form of a moon disk is also the moon disk.

original: de'i steng du rdo rje rtse lnga par h'um yang sgom mo //
analyzed: de'i steng du rdo rje rtse lnga par h'um yang sgom mo //
translated: On top of that, one should meditate on the syllable hūṃ as a five-pronged vajra.

original: der de bzhin gshegs @514a *//
analyzed: der de bzhin gshegs @514a *//
translated: All the tathāgatas enter there.

original: pa thams cad bcug cing der yang rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed nas bkug ste /
analyzed: pa thams cad bcug cing der yang rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed nas bkug ste /
translated: Having generated Vajrasattva there, one should summon him,

original: padma'i gdan la bzhugs su gsol ba dang / ji ltar spyan ma la sogs pa'i sprul par yang bzhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i gdan la bzhugs su gsol ba dang / ji ltar spyan ma la sogs pa'i sprul par yang bzhugs par bya'o //
translated: and request him to sit on the lotus seat, and also to sit as the emanations of Locanā and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de ltar rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i yang rang gi rigs kyi 'byung ba'i sbyor ba blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i yang rang gi rigs kyi 'byung ba'i sbyor ba blta bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should view the application of the origin of Vairocana and so forth of one’s own family.

original: 'dis ni yang rab tu sbyor bas gang zhig de rnams skye ba de ni nyi ma dang / zla ba 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni yang rab tu sbyor bas gang zhig de rnams skye ba de ni nyi ma dang / zla ba 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: By this, whatever is generated by them is like the origin of the sun and moon.

original: phyi rol dang / nang gi bdag nyid las yi ge lngar 'gyur ba'i phyir lha mo thams cad gnyis las skyes pa dang rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol dang / nang gi bdag nyid las yi ge lngar 'gyur ba'i phyir lha mo thams cad gnyis las skyes pa dang rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Since the five syllables arise from the external and internal natures, all goddesses are born from the two and are perfected.

original: las thams cad rab tu rgyas par 'byung ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: las thams cad rab tu rgyas par 'byung ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the ritual for the arising of the full development of all activities.

original: la la zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: la la zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba'o //
translated: The phrase some means those who have not seen.

original: rang gi sems so sor rtog pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: rang gi sems so sor rtog pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The phrase their own mind means the mind of awakening.

original: byang chub tu btab pa'i sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu btab pa'i sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The phrase awakening heroes means the heroes of awakening.

original: de'i spyod pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i spyod pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa ste /
translated: The phrase their conduct means the conduct of awakening.

original: ji ltar sems dpa' yang dag par rnyed nas rjes su 'brangs pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sems dpa' yang dag par rnyed nas rjes su 'brangs pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: The phrase they follow means that they follow the mind of awakening after it has been found.

original: rgyal bar byed pa dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa dang / don thams cad grub par byed pa'i ming po gsum gyi gzugs kyis gnas pa'i tshul gyis dang / sems can gyi don byed de /
analyzed: rgyal bar byed pa dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa dang / don thams cad grub par byed pa'i ming po gsum gyi gzugs kyis gnas pa'i tshul gyis dang / sems can gyi don byed de /
translated: The phrase the three brothers means the three brothers who are the victors, the honeymakers, and the fulfillers of all aims. They abide in the form of the three brothers and work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de nyid sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de nyid sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'gyur zhing /
translated: The phrase they transform means that they transform into various forms.

original: rdul dang / mun pa dang / snying stobs kyang sems can gyi don du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdul dang / mun pa dang / snying stobs kyang sems can gyi don du 'gyur te /
translated: The elements of passion, darkness, and purity also serve the purpose of sentient beings.

original: gang zhig rnam par dag pa de ni kun tu bzang po'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par dag pa de ni kun tu bzang po'o //
translated: That which is pure is Samantabhadra.🔽Therefore, this conduct of enlightenment is called the 'way of following'.

original: de bas na byang chub kyi @514b spyod pa 'di ni ji ltar rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub kyi @514b spyod pa 'di ni ji ltar rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: The 'way of following' is as explained above.

original: kha ba nas gsal bar 'byung ba'am zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don du skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: kha ba nas gsal bar 'byung ba'am zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don du skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu rdzogs pa ste /
translated: Or, as it appears clearly in the snow, means that for the sake of sentient beings, the thirty-two marks and eighty minor marks of a great being are perfected.

original: bsod nams kyi phung po de'i nyi zer gyi rdul ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams so //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi phung po de'i nyi zer gyi rdul ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams so //
translated: The dust particles of that heap of merit are the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: de rnams kyi rdul ni dpe byad bzang po rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rdul ni dpe byad bzang po rnams so //
translated: The dust particles of those are the minor marks.

original: gsal bar gyur pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsal bar gyur pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that clear appearance?

original: gsal ba ni khyad par du yon tan la sogs pa 'dzin ste /
analyzed: gsal ba ni khyad par du yon tan la sogs pa 'dzin ste /
translated: Clear appearance is the special grasping of qualities and so forth.

original: byang chub chen po'i mchod pa ni de rnams kyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i mchod pa ni de rnams kyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The worship of great enlightenment is the complete circle of those assemblies.

original: bdud kyi gzugs kyis byang chub sems dpa' slu ba ni skyes pa'i bdud de /
analyzed: bdud kyi gzugs kyis byang chub sems dpa' slu ba ni skyes pa'i bdud de /
translated: The deception of the Bodhisattva by the form of Mara is the Mara of birth.

original: nyan thos dang / rang byang chub kyi sems gsod pa'i phyir bdud ni 'dod chags rdo rje'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang byang chub kyi sems gsod pa'i phyir bdud ni 'dod chags rdo rje'o //
translated: The Mara of desire is the one who kills the thought of the Disciples and the Pratyekabuddhas.

original: bdud bzhi bcom pa dang ldan zhing bdud las rgyal bar kha cig tu sh'akya thub par gyur pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom pa dang ldan zhing bdud las rgyal bar kha cig tu sh'akya thub par gyur pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: The one who is endowed with the destruction of the four Maras and the victory over Mara is the one who, in some places, having become Sakyamuni, is fully enlightened.

original: chos dang / gang zag tu 'dzin pa tshar bcad pa'i phyir thar pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang / gang zag tu 'dzin pa tshar bcad pa'i phyir thar pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The one who is pure in liberation is the one who destroys the grasping of the Dharma and the person.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i gang zag tshar bcad pa'i phyir dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos su 'dzin pa tshar bcad pa'i phyir de ltar chos dang / gang zag la bdag med par rtogs nas ji ltar gyur pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir thar pa thams cad rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i gang zag tshar bcad pa'i phyir dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos su 'dzin pa tshar bcad pa'i phyir de ltar chos dang / gang zag la bdag med par rtogs nas ji ltar gyur pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir thar pa thams cad rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: In order to destroy the person who is a worldly yogin, and in order to destroy the grasping of the dharmas of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, having realized the selflessness of the person and the dharmas, all liberations are purified, because of understanding the way things are.

original: 'di'i don du bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don du bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: For this purpose, the Bhagavat Vairocana turns the wheel of the Dharma.

original: bdag tu lta @515a *//
analyzed: bdag tu lta @515a *//
translated: The view of self,

original: pa / rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis dang / 'dod chags rnam pa thams cad dang / de'i rnam par dag ba ste /
analyzed: pa / rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis dang / 'dod chags rnam pa thams cad dang / de'i rnam par dag ba ste /
translated: the sixty-two views, and all attachments, and their purification,

original: de kho na la bdag mi dmigs pas rang bzhin med pa'i phyir de'i don /
analyzed: de kho na la bdag mi dmigs pas rang bzhin med pa'i phyir de'i don /
translated: are the meaning of this, because of the non-apprehension of self in reality, and because of the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: du spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po ni padma gar gyi dbang phyug yin no //
analyzed: du spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po ni padma gar gyi dbang phyug yin no //
translated: The lord Avalokiteśvara is Padmanarteśvara.

original: dga' ldan gyi lha rnams thams cad kyi mthar thug pa la 'khor lo dam pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi lha rnams thams cad kyi mthar thug pa la 'khor lo dam pa'o //
translated: The supreme wheel of the gods of Tuṣita is the ultimate of all the gods.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi tsho 'phrul sna tshogs pa'i mchog ni lha'i 'khor lo dam pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi tsho 'phrul sna tshogs pa'i mchog ni lha'i 'khor lo dam pa'o //
translated: The supreme wheel of the gods is the supreme of all the various miracles of magical power.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: yang na ni /
analyzed: yang na ni /
translated: Or else,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'dus pa zhes bya ba la 'du ba ni tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'dus pa zhes bya ba la 'du ba ni tshogs pa'o //
translated: The so-called assembly of all buddhas is an assembly.

original: bde ba can zhes bya ba ni mchog gi dga' ldan te /
analyzed: bde ba can zhes bya ba ni mchog gi dga' ldan te /
translated: The so-called Blissful is the supreme Tuṣita.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams lta bu'o //
analyzed: bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams lta bu'o //
translated: it is like the world system of Sukhāvatī.

original: dper na / bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dus pas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: dper na / bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dus pas brgyan pa'o //
translated: For example, the world system of Sukhāvatī is adorned with the assembly of all tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das padma gar gyi dbang phyug dang / dpal rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa gzhal du med pas kun tu bskor bas /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das padma gar gyi dbang phyug dang / dpal rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa gzhal du med pas kun tu bskor bas /
translated: In the same way, the Blessed One, Padmanarteśvara, and the glorious Vairocana and so forth, surrounded by innumerable tathāgatas,

original: de ni bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams lta bu ste /
analyzed: de ni bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams lta bu ste /
translated: are like the world system of Sukhāvatī.

original: de'i don du padma gar gyi dbang phyug sgrol ba po 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i don du padma gar gyi dbang phyug sgrol ba po 'byung ba yin no //
translated: For that purpose, Padmanarteśvara is the liberator.

original: sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa po dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa'i sbyin pas ser sna spang ba'i phyir don dam par rnam par dag pa de'i don du ser sna can gyi sems can rnams 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i ye shes kyis shin tu sbyin pa la sbyor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa po dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa'i sbyin pas ser sna spang ba'i phyir don dam par rnam par dag pa de'i don du ser sna can gyi sems can rnams 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i ye shes kyis shin tu sbyin pa la sbyor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i
translated: By the generosity of the non-apprehension of the giver, the gift, and the recipient, in order to abandon stinginess, for the sake of that ultimate purity, stingy sentient beings are joined to generosity by the wisdom of the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: don @515b to //
analyzed: don @515b to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: nyi ma lta bu'i phyag rgya chen po ni nyi ma'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma lta bu'i phyag rgya chen po ni nyi ma'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The great seal like the sun is the sun seal.🔽The one called Ākāśagarbha is so-called because the essence is produced from the wisdom of equality in space.

original: nam mkha'i snying po zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes las snying po bskyed pa'i phyir gang gi 'di ni de de bzhin du gsung so; ;dngos grub thams cad kyi dbang phyug bsam pa thams cad yongs su skong bar byed pa ni
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes las snying po bskyed pa'i phyir gang gi 'di ni de de bzhin du gsung so; ;dngos grub thams cad kyi dbang phyug bsam pa thams cad yongs su skong bar byed pa ni
translated: The lord of all powers, fulfilling all wishes,

original: sems can thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad du 'khor los bsgyur ba la sogs par gsol ba 'debs ba de rnams kyi bsam pa de rab tu sbyin pas thams cad kyi bsam pa skong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad du 'khor los bsgyur ba la sogs par gsol ba 'debs ba de rnams kyi bsam pa de rab tu sbyin pas thams cad kyi bsam pa skong bar byed pa ste /
translated: The supplication of all sentient beings in every way to become universal monarchs, etc. is their thought. Giving that is fulfilling the thought of all.

original: de'i phyir / bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bka' stsal pa /
translated: Therefore, it says, The Blessed One said:

original: nam mkha' la glang po la sogs pa rin po che sna bdun gyi rin po che thams cad kyi char 'bebs pa zhes bya ba ni rin po che bdun gyi char 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la glang po la sogs pa rin po che sna bdun gyi rin po che thams cad kyi char 'bebs pa zhes bya ba ni rin po che bdun gyi char 'bab pa'o //
translated: In the sky, the rain of all jewels, which is the rain of the seven jewels, of elephants, etc., falls.

original: de'i don du sgrol ma 'byung ba ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i don du sgrol ma 'byung ba ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba yin no //
translated: For that purpose, the origin of Tara is the conqueror of the three worlds.

original: shin tu brtson 'grus dman pa zhes pa de ni le lo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu brtson 'grus dman pa zhes pa de ni le lo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The very weak effort is laziness, etc.

original: stobs kyi rnal 'byor ni drag po'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: stobs kyi rnal 'byor ni drag po'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The yoga of power is the yoga of violence.

original: de bas na stobs kyi rnal 'byor gyis rnam par dag pa ni drag shul gyi rnal 'byor gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na stobs kyi rnal 'byor gyis rnam par dag pa ni drag shul gyi rnal 'byor gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, purification by the yoga of power is purification by the yoga of violence.

original: brtson 'grus kyi sbyor bas ni de'i don du stobs kyi rnal 'byor rnam par dag pas rta mchog 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi sbyor bas ni de'i don du stobs kyi rnal 'byor rnam par dag pas rta mchog 'byung ba yin te /
translated: By the application of effort, he is the source of the supreme horse, by the pure yoga of power for that purpose.

original: rta mgrin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rta mgrin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He is Hayagriva, is the meaning.

original: dpung pa bzhi dang / lag pa bzhi zhes bya ba 'di ni phyag brgyad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dpung pa bzhi dang / lag pa bzhi zhes bya ba 'di ni phyag brgyad pa lta bu'o //
translated: The four arms and four hands are like the eight-armed one.

original: zhabs bzhi zhes bya ba ni g-yon brkyang ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: zhabs bzhi zhes bya ba ni g-yon brkyang ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The four feet are the posture of left leg extended.

original: de nas g-yas pa'i zhabs gcig gis ni omi'i dngos grub mdang dpal mo mnan to //🔽gnyis pas ni lha mo sha @516a *//
analyzed: de nas g-yas pa'i zhabs gcig gis ni omi'i dngos grub mdang dpal mo mnan to // gnyis pas ni lha mo sha @516a *//
translated: Then, with one right foot he tramples on Oum, the glory of siddhi.

original: ci dang / dga' ma mnan pa'o //
analyzed: ci dang / dga' ma mnan pa'o //
translated: With the second he tramples on the goddess Shachi and his beloved.

original: g-yon gyi dang pos ni mig gsum pa dang / khyab 'jug go /
analyzed: g-yon gyi dang pos ni mig gsum pa dang / khyab 'jug go /
translated: With the first left he tramples on the three-eyed one, Vishnu.

original: gnyis pas ni tshangs pa dang / 'dod lha mnan nas bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni tshangs pa dang / 'dod lha mnan nas bzhugs so //
translated: With the second he tramples on Brahma and Kamadeva.

original: dngos grub thams cad kyi dbang phyug rta mchog gis ni 'jig rten gsum po lha chen po la sogs pa de rnams bsdus nas gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam par btul ba gang zhig rdo rje h'um mdzad kyis 'jig rten gsum po🔽thams cad bsgral nas /
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad kyi dbang phyug rta mchog gis ni 'jig rten gsum po lha chen po la sogs pa de rnams bsdus nas gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam par btul ba gang zhig rdo rje h'um mdzad kyis 'jig rten gsum po thams cad bsgral nas /
translated: Then Vajra Humkara liberated the three worlds🔽and in his mandala the great gods offered the dakini Lady of the Cavern as a gift and were liberated.

original: de'i dkyil 'khor du lha chen pos bla ma la dka' bzlog ma yon du phul nas phyung ba ni rim pa ji lta bar gru bzhi sgo bzhi bar thig gdab par bya zhing sgeg mo la sogs pas yongs su gang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor du lha chen pos bla ma la dka' bzlog ma yon du phul nas phyung ba ni rim pa ji lta bar gru bzhi sgo bzhi bar thig gdab par bya zhing sgeg mo la sogs pas yongs su gang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the line “the square with four doors, filled with Charu and so forth” is that one should measure the mandala in four stages, each one cubit in size.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi tshad gang gis thig gdab par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi tshad gang gis thig gdab par bya zhe na /
translated: By what measure should one measure the mandala?

original: nang du khru gang zhes bya ba ni dbus su khru gang ste /
analyzed: nang du khru gang zhes bya ba ni dbus su khru gang ste /
translated: “One cubit inside” means one cubit in the center.

original: phyi rol du khru gang nyid dang / 'phar ma gsum pa khru gnyis pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du khru gang nyid dang / 'phar ma gsum pa khru gnyis pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that one cubit outside and three inches is two cubits.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi snying po zlum po yin no zhes bya bar bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gsum po sgrol ba'i dkyil 'khor bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi snying po zlum po yin no zhes bya bar bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gsum po sgrol ba'i dkyil 'khor bka' stsal to //
translated: The mandala is like the orb of the moon, the circular center of the mandala, as the Blessed One has taught in the mandala of the savior of the three worlds.

original: da ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgom pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi sgom par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgom pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi sgom par bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the meditation on the resistances and the meditation on the factors of enlightenment should be explained.

original: de la re zhig dang por tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni sred pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la re zhig dang por tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni sred pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, first of all, the meditation on the body is the meditation on the four noble truths, because incorrect mental activity is the cause of craving.

original: rmongs pa las bden pa bzhi la 'jug pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ni @516b lus la tshul bzhin ma yin pa sgom pa ste /
analyzed: rmongs pa las bden pa bzhi la 'jug pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ni @516b lus la tshul bzhin ma yin pa sgom pa ste /
translated: The meditation on the applications of mindfulness is the meditation on the body, because one enters into the four noble truths through delusion.

original: de yongs su brtags pas gang zhig sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su brtags pas gang zhig sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Through the investigation of that, one enters into the truth of suffering.

original: de'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: de'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal te /
translated: Incorrect mental activity is the characteristic of the formative forces, therefore incorrect mental activity is the suffering of the formative forces.

original: de dang lhan cig zag pa med pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyi sdug bsngal gang zhig lta ba'i phyir tshor ba ni sred pa'i rgyu'i phyir te yongs su brtags pas kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig zag pa med pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyi sdug bsngal gang zhig lta ba'i phyir tshor ba ni sred pa'i rgyu'i phyir te yongs su brtags pas kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug go /
translated: Since it is the cause of craving, feeling is the origin of suffering. Thus he penetrates the truth of origination through the investigation of the aggregates.

original: bdag gi dngos po la mngon par zhen pa ni sems de yongs su brtags pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po la mngon par zhen pa ni sems de yongs su brtags pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug go /
translated: Since the mind is investigated in the truth of cessation through the non-apprehension of the self and its belongings, he penetrates the truth of cessation.

original: bdag tu lta ba gcod pas rtogs pa'i phyir chos la brtags pas gang zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad la rmongs pa med pa'i phyir lam gyi bden pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba gcod pas rtogs pa'i phyir chos la brtags pas gang zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad la rmongs pa med pa'i phyir lam gyi bden pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Since he penetrates the truth of the path through the investigation of the dharmas, i.e. through the elimination of the view of self, he penetrates the truth of the path because he is not confused about all the dharmas of affliction and purification.

original: de ltar dang por bden pa bzhi la 'jug pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bsgom pa rnam par bzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar dang por bden pa bzhi la 'jug pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bsgom pa rnam par bzhag par bya ste /
translated: Thus, in order to first enter the four noble truths, the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness is presented.

original: de nas yang dag par spong ba'i sgom pa yongs su shes la; gang gi phyir mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa thams cad du de rtogs na brtson 'grus rnam pa bzhi po 'di rab tu rtsom mo //🔽dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su shes nas mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su shes @517a *//
analyzed: de nas yang dag par spong ba'i sgom pa yongs su shes la; gang gi phyir mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa thams cad du de rtogs na brtson 'grus rnam pa bzhi po 'di rab tu rtsom mo // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su shes nas mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su shes @517a *//
translated: Then, the cultivation of the right efforts is fully understood, because when one realizes all the aspects of the favorable side and unfavorable side, one undertakes these four kinds of right efforts.

original: par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rnam pa bzhi yang dag par rab tu rtsom ste /
analyzed: par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rnam pa bzhi yang dag par rab tu rtsom ste /
translated: Having cultivated the applications of mindfulness, one fully understands all the aspects of the favorable side and unfavorable side. In order to fully understand the favorable side and in order to fully understand the unfavorable side, one undertakes the four kinds of right efforts.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chor skye  rnams spang ba'i phyir zhes rgyas par gong du gsungs so; ;las nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de la don thams cad yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chor skye  rnams spang ba'i phyir zhes rgyas par gong du gsungs so; ;las nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de la don thams cad yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon the arising of evil, unwholesome dharmas, and so on at length.

original: skyon lnga spang ba dang / 'du byed brgyad bsten pas de'i phyir yongs su shes pas brtson 'grus kyi sgom pas sems gnas pa'i las nyid do //
analyzed: skyon lnga spang ba dang / 'du byed brgyad bsten pas de'i phyir yongs su shes pas brtson 'grus kyi sgom pas sems gnas pa'i las nyid do //
translated: The work of the mind's stability is due to the cultivation of effort through complete understanding, by abandoning the five faults and relying on the eight formative factors.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni don thams cad yang dag par 'phel ba'i rgyu'i phyir gnas pa ni 'dir sems kyi ting nge 'dzin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni don thams cad yang dag par 'phel ba'i rgyu'i phyir gnas pa ni 'dir sems kyi ting nge 'dzin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The four bases of supernatural power are the cause for the complete increase of all aims. Here, stability should be understood as the concentration of the mind.

original: de nas yang dag par spong ba'i mthar rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa de yang las nyid de /
analyzed: de nas yang dag par spong ba'i mthar rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa de yang las nyid de /
translated: Then, the work of the bases of supernatural power is the same as that of the correct exertions,

original: skyon lnga spang ba dang / 'du byed brgyad bsgoms pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skyon lnga spang ba dang / 'du byed brgyad bsgoms pas rig par bya'o //
translated: by abandoning the five faults and cultivating the eight formative factors.

original: skyon lnga gang lags /
analyzed: skyon lnga gang lags /
translated: What are the five faults?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: de la le lo dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / rmugs pa dang / bying ba dang / rgod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la le lo dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / rmugs pa dang / bying ba dang / rgod pa nyid do //
translated: Laziness, lack of awareness, sluggishness, excitability, and lack of faith.

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa dang / de nas mngon par 'du bya ba skyon lnga spang bar lnga po 'di rnams brjod do //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa dang / de nas mngon par 'du bya ba skyon lnga spang bar lnga po 'di rnams brjod do //
translated: The five faults are mentioned in the context of the five limbs of the path of application, which are: non-application, application, non-exertion, exertion, and over-exertion.

original: de la bying ba dang / rgod pas skyon gcig byed de /
analyzed: de la bying ba dang / rgod pas skyon gcig byed de /
translated: Sluggishness and excitability are one fault,🔽because they both cause non-application when they occur.

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa bying ba dang / rgod pa 'jug pa'i dus su skyon no //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa bying ba dang / rgod pa 'jug pa'i dus su skyon no //
translated: Non-application is a fault in the context of tranquility, and application is a fault in the context of insight.

original: mngon par 'dus byas pas rab tu zhi ba la 'di rnams spang ba'i phyir ji ltar spang zhing 'du byed brgyad rnam par bzhag ce na /
analyzed: mngon par 'dus byas pas rab tu zhi ba la 'di rnams spang ba'i phyir ji ltar spang zhing 'du byed brgyad rnam par bzhag ce na /
translated: How are the eight applications to be posited in order to eliminate those faults?

original: bzhi yis le lo spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa dang @517b rtsol ba dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa de rnams yang rim pa ji lta bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi yis le lo spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa dang @517b rtsol ba dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa de rnams yang rim pa ji lta bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Four are for the elimination of laziness: aspiration, initiative, faith, and pliancy.

original: gnas dang / de nas gnas pa dang / de'i mtshan ma dang / 'bras bu nyid de /
analyzed: gnas dang / de nas gnas pa dang / de'i mtshan ma dang / 'bras bu nyid de /
translated: The basis, the state of being based, its sign, and its result.

original: gnas ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: The basis is aspiration.

original: gnas pa ni rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni rtsol ba'o //
translated: Steadfastness is effort.

original: de'i gnas 'dun pa'i mtshan ma ni dad pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnas 'dun pa'i mtshan ma ni dad pa ste /
translated: The sign of aspiration, which is the basis of that, is faith,

original: yid ches pa dang / dang ba dang / 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa dang / dang ba dang / 'dod pa'o //
translated: which is confidence, clarity, and desire.

original: de'i gnas pa rtsol ba'i 'bras bu ni shin tu sbyangs pa te /
analyzed: de'i gnas pa rtsol ba'i 'bras bu ni shin tu sbyangs pa te /
translated: The result of the steadfastness of effort is fitness,

original: 'dun pa dang bcas pa'i brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis khyad par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang bcas pa'i brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis khyad par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: which is to be understood as the special realization of samadhi through effort that is accompanied by aspiration.

original: lhag ma spong ba'i 'du byed bzhi ni dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems dpa' dang / btang snyoms te /
analyzed: lhag ma spong ba'i 'du byed bzhi ni dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems dpa' dang / btang snyoms te /
translated: The remaining four applications of abandoning are mindfulness, introspective awareness, mental exertion, and equanimity.

original: grangs ji lta bar skyon bzhi'i gnyen po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: grangs ji lta bar skyon bzhi'i gnyen po'i phyogs so //
translated: They are the factors that are the antidotes to the four faults in the order in which they are presented.

original: de yang dran pa la sogs pa'i rim pa de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang dran pa la sogs pa'i rim pa de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, they should be understood in the same order as mindfulness and so forth.

original: dmigs pa ni rmugs pa med pas bying ba dang / rgod pa rjes su rtogs par bya zhing de nyid kyi mngon par 'du byed pa zhi ba la shin tu spyangs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni rmugs pa med pas bying ba dang / rgod pa rjes su rtogs par bya zhing de nyid kyi mngon par 'du byed pa zhi ba la shin tu spyangs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The object of mindfulness is the absence of dullness, which is the recognition of laxity and excitement. The application of that is the pacification of the manifest levels of laxity and excitement, which is fitness.

original: dran pa ni dmigs pa na rmugs pa med pas shes bzhin te /
analyzed: dran pa ni dmigs pa na rmugs pa med pas shes bzhin te /
translated: The object of introspective awareness is the absence of dullness, which is mindfulness.

original: rmugs pa med par gyur na bying ba dang / rgod pa rjes su rtogs so //
analyzed: rmugs pa med par gyur na bying ba dang / rgod pa rjes su rtogs so //
translated: When there is no sluggishness, he understands laxity and excitement.

original: ma rtogs pa de rtogs par bya ba'i don du mngon par 'du byed pa'i sems kyis bying ba dang / rgod pa zhi pa la dam pa shin tu sbyangs pa'i sems kyi btang snyoms so //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa de rtogs par bya ba'i don du mngon par 'du byed pa'i sems kyis bying ba dang / rgod pa zhi pa la dam pa shin tu sbyangs pa'i sems kyi btang snyoms so //
translated: In order to understand what has not been understood, he makes an effort with a mind that is not sluggish, and he attains the equanimity of a mind that is tranquil and well cultivated, having pacified laxity and excitement.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i mthar dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga po de rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar dgod ce na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i mthar dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga po de rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar dgod ce na /
translated: How are the five faculties of faith, etc. established as the culmination of the bases of psychic power?

original: thar pa'i cha dang ldan pa gang zhig 'dun pa'i rnal 'byor gyi bdag po dang / @518a *//
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang ldan pa gang zhig 'dun pa'i rnal 'byor gyi bdag po dang / @518a *//
translated: The faculty of faith is the master of aspiration for liberation.

original: dmigs pa na rmugs pa med pas brjed pa med pa'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa na rmugs pa med pas brjed pa med pa'i bdag po'o //
translated: The faculty of mindfulness is the master of non-forgetfulness due to the absence of sluggishness in the object.

original: bdag po zhes bya ba ni bsgyur bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po zhes bya ba ni bsgyur bar byed pa'o //
translated: Master means that which transforms.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i las ni sems kyi 'jug pa'o; ;thar pa'i cha dang ldan pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la 'dun pa'i bdag po dang / rab tu sbyor ba'i bdag po dang / dmigs pa na rmugs pa med pa'i bdag po dang / brjed pa med pa'i bdag po dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i las ni sems kyi 'jug pa'o; ;thar pa'i cha dang ldan pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la 'dun pa'i bdag po dang / rab tu sbyor ba'i bdag po dang / dmigs pa na rmugs pa med pa'i bdag po dang / brjed pa med pa'i bdag po dang /
translated: the mastery of non-forgetfulness,

original: rnam par 'byed pa'i bdag po ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa'i bdag po ste /
translated: and the mastery of analysis.

original: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga po rnams rig par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga po rnams rig par bya'o //
translated: The five faculties of faith and so forth should be understood in the same order.

original: de la za ba po dang / bza' bar bya bas stong pa bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de la za ba po dang / bza' bar bya bas stong pa bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha taught the emptiness of the experiencer and the experienced.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams nas brtsams te /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with the internal sense bases,

original: phyi rol gyi bza' ba stong pa nyid dang / de'i lus kyi za ba po dang / bza' ba dag gang zhig byin gyis brlabs pa'i lus de'i stong pa nyid la'ang lta zhing skyo bas 'du byed spong bar byed de dge ba mi zad pa dang /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bza' ba stong pa nyid dang / de'i lus kyi za ba po dang / bza' ba dag gang zhig byin gyis brlabs pa'i lus de'i stong pa nyid la'ang lta zhing skyo bas 'du byed spong bar byed de dge ba mi zad pa dang /
translated: he taught the emptiness of the external food, the emptiness of the body that is the experiencer of that food, and the emptiness of the body that is consecrated.

original: gang yang khyad par du bltas pas nang dang / phyi rol stong pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: gang yang khyad par du bltas pas nang dang / phyi rol stong pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: And since it is also seen as distinct, it is said to be the emptiness of the external and the internal.🔽The emptiness of the great is so called because it is the emptiness of the great receptacle world.

original: rab tu gnas pa'i dngos po snod kyi 'jig rten rgyas pa'i phyir de stong pa nyid ni chen po stong pa nyid ces gsungs so; ;de'ang nang gi skye mched rnams la sogs pa gang gis stong pa nyid mthong ba stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi de'i stong🔽pa nyid ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rab tu gnas pa'i dngos po snod kyi 'jig rten rgyas pa'i phyir de stong pa nyid ni chen po stong pa nyid ces gsungs so; ;de'ang nang gi skye mched rnams la sogs pa gang gis stong pa nyid mthong ba stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi de'i stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is the emptiness of the emptiness of the internal and external, which is seen by the wisdom of emptiness.

original: ji ltar don @518b dam pa'i rnam pas mthong ba'i de'i stong pa nyid ni don dam pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar don @518b dam pa'i rnam pas mthong ba'i de'i stong pa nyid ni don dam pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the ultimate, which is seen by the ultimate.

original: de'i don du'ang byang chub sems dpas rab tu spyod do //
analyzed: de'i don du'ang byang chub sems dpas rab tu spyod do //
translated: The bodhisattva practices for the sake of that emptiness.

original: de'i stong pa nyid kyi don ji ltar 'tshal phar bgyi //
analyzed: de'i stong pa nyid kyi don ji ltar 'tshal phar bgyi //
translated: How should the bodhisattva understand the meaning of the emptiness of that?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: dge ba gnyis 'thob pa'i don du dge ba'i 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / 'dus ma byas gnyis so //
analyzed: dge ba gnyis 'thob pa'i don du dge ba'i 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / 'dus ma byas gnyis so //
translated: The emptiness of that is the emptiness of beginningless and endless.🔽In order to always benefit sentient beings and in order not to abandon cyclic existence for the sake of the welfare of sentient beings, one does not abandon virtue.

original: rtag tu sems can la phan pa'i phyir dang; sems can la shin tu phan pa'i don du 'khor ba mi spang ba'i phyir de'i stong pa nyid ni thog ma dang / tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtag tu sems can la phan pa'i phyir dang; sems can la shin tu phan pa'i don du 'khor ba mi spang ba'i phyir de'i stong pa nyid ni thog ma dang / tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that is the emptiness of beginningless and endless.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par 'khor ba stong pa nyid du ma mthong bas skyo ste /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par 'khor ba stong pa nyid du ma mthong bas skyo ste /
translated: One becomes weary of cyclic existence because one does not see cyclic existence as empty without interruption.

original: 'khor ba yongs su spong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su spong bar byed do //
translated: One abandons cyclic existence.🔽One does not attain nirvana through the view that virtue is not exhausted. The emptiness of that is the emptiness of nonrejection.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate🔽is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: gang yang dge ba mi zad par khyad par du lta bas mya ngan las 'das par yang mi byed cing de'i stong pa nyid spong bar yang mi byed de /
analyzed: gang yang dge ba mi zad par khyad par du lta bas mya ngan las 'das par yang mi byed cing de'i stong pa nyid spong bar yang mi byed de /
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: 'di ni blang ba dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid do //🔽rigs kyang rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /🔽rigs ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di ni blang ba dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid do // rigs kyang rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la / rigs ni rang bzhin te /
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is

original: mtshan dang / dpe byad thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan dang / dpe byad thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to obtain the major and minor marks.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang / dpe byad dang bcas par thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / dag par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rnams rab tu spyod de /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang / dpe byad dang bcas par thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / dag par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rnams rab tu spyod de /
translated: In order to obtain the major and minor marks of a great being, and in order to purify them, the bodhisattvas practice the buddha qualities.

original: khyad par gyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sbyang ba'i phyir re zhig stong pa nyid bcu bzhir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sbyang ba'i phyir re zhig stong pa nyid bcu bzhir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: In order to purify the special powers, fearlessnesses, etc., the fourteen kinds of emptiness should be understood as posited.

original: yang 'dir stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'dir stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is emptiness here?

original: chos @519a *// dang; gang zag gi don dngos po med pa stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos @519a *// dang; gang zag gi don dngos po med pa stong pa nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of the nonexistence of the object of the person and of the object of the dharma.

original: de'i phyir de las byung ba don dam pa'i dngos po ni der de stong pa nyid dang / phyi rol gyi chos dang / gang zag dngos po med pa nyid las byung ba'i gcig pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las byung ba don dam pa'i dngos po ni der de stong pa nyid dang / phyi rol gyi chos dang / gang zag dngos po med pa nyid las byung ba'i gcig pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: Therefore, the ultimate reality that arises from that is empty of that, and the single reality that arises from the nonexistence of the external dharma and the person is empty of that.

original: der ji skad gsungs pa'i zab mo la sogs pa stong pa'i phyir stong pa nyid bcu drug tu mtshan nyid bshad pa'i don du gzhung gnyis su stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: der ji skad gsungs pa'i zab mo la sogs pa stong pa'i phyir stong pa nyid bcu drug tu mtshan nyid bshad pa'i don du gzhung gnyis su stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of the sixteen characteristics of emptiness, the two texts present the classification of emptinesses.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of non-existence and the emptiness of the nature of non-existence.

original: chos dag gang zag la yang dag par 'jug pa de'i stong pa nyid ji snyed pa yongs su spang ba'i don du rim pa ji lta ba de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chos dag gang zag la yang dag par 'jug pa de'i stong pa nyid ji snyed pa yongs su spang ba'i don du rim pa ji lta ba de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The classification of emptinesses should be understood in this order in order to abandon the emptinesses that are the objects of the persons who engage in the Dharma.

original: ji ltar sgrub par rnam par shes par bya zhe na /🔽gal te 'di kun nas nyon mongs pa can du ma gyur na lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub par rnam par shes par bya zhe na / gal te 'di kun nas nyon mongs pa can du ma gyur na lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: How should one understand the proof of emptiness?🔽If this world were not defiled, all embodied beings would be liberated.

original: gal te 'di rnam par dag par ma gyur na brtsams pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di rnam par dag par ma gyur na brtsams pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If this world were not purified, all endeavors would be fruitless.

original: gal te chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid glo bur gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ma skyes pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du ma gyur na kun nas nyon mongs pa dngos po med pa'i phyir 'bad pa med pa nyid du
analyzed: gal te chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid glo bur gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ma skyes pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du ma gyur na kun nas nyon mongs pa dngos po med pa'i phyir 'bad pa med pa nyid du
translated: If the emptiness of phenomena were not defiled by the adverse side, because the adventitious afflictions do not arise, then, because the afflictions would be insubstantial,

original: sems can thams cad grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: all sentient beings would be liberated without effort.

original: de nas ma skyes pa'i yang @519b mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis rnam par dag par ma gyur te /
analyzed: de nas ma skyes pa'i yang @519b mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis rnam par dag par ma gyur te /
translated: Then, because the adverse side would not arise, there would be no purification.

original: thar pa'i don du rtsom pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thar pa'i don du rtsom pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The effort for the sake of liberation would be fruitless.

original: de ltar byas na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa can ma yin pa dang / dag pa dang ma dag pa nyid sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i phyir de ji ltar na nyon mongs pa yang ma yin zhing ma dag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa can ma yin pa dang / dag pa dang ma dag pa nyid sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i phyir de ji ltar na nyon mongs pa yang ma yin zhing ma dag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because the nature of mind is clear light, it is neither defiled nor undefiled, neither pure nor impure. How then could it be defiled or impure?

original: nyon mongs pa glo bur gyi phyir ji ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin zhing dag pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa glo bur gyi phyir ji ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin zhing dag pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Because the afflictions are adventitious, [the mind] is neither afflicted nor pure.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the divisions of emptiness have been taught.

original: de la stong pa nyid kyi mdor bsdus pa'i don sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid kyi mdor bsdus pa'i don sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of the summary of emptiness is established.

original: yang gsungs pa; 'dod chags kyi gnyen por mi sdug pa la sogs pa dang / zhe sdang gi gnyen por byams pa dang / gti mug gi gnyen por rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang gsungs pa; 'dod chags kyi gnyen por mi sdug pa la sogs pa dang / zhe sdang gi gnyen por byams pa dang / gti mug gi gnyen por rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is said: “The antidotes to desire are the unappealing, etc., the antidote to hatred is love, and the antidote to delusion is dependent origination.”

original: de la ji ltar 'dod chags rnam par ldog ce na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar 'dod chags rnam par ldog ce na /
translated: How does desire cease?

original: gal te de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If it is because of being incompatible with it,

original: yin mod kyi gang zhig de skad du 'dod chags kyi bdag nyid du byed pa na 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no; ;de bzhin du gsungs pa /
analyzed: yin mod kyi gang zhig de skad du 'dod chags kyi bdag nyid du byed pa na 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no; ;de bzhin du gsungs pa /
translated: then it is so, but when one makes it the nature of desire, one is free from desire. Thus it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family!

original: ae ma ho /
analyzed: ae ma ho /
translated: Amazing!

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'dod chags kyi ye shes ni rnyog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'dod chags kyi ye shes ni rnyog pa med pa ste /
translated: The pristine wisdom of desire of all the Buddhas is unpolluted.

original: 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba bcom nas bde ba thams cad sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba bcom nas bde ba thams cad sbyin par byed do //
translated: Having destroyed desire with desire, it bestows all happiness.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba med pa dang bcas pa ste /🔽gzhan du rgyun du zhugs @520a *//
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba med pa dang bcas pa ste / gzhan du rgyun du zhugs @520a *//
translated: Desire and so forth are not by nature sinful.

original: pa'i 'dod chags rnyed pa yin na de'i 'dod chags la sogs pa yongs su mi spong bar spyod na /
analyzed: pa'i 'dod chags rnyed pa yin na de'i 'dod chags la sogs pa yongs su mi spong bar spyod na /
translated: Otherwise, if the stream-winner were to find desire, he would not be able to practice without eliminating that desire and so forth.

original: 'on te rim pa'i khyad par las yon tan gyi khyad par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te rim pa'i khyad par las yon tan gyi khyad par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But the difference in the qualities arises from the difference in the stages.

original: dper na ke ta ka'i me tog dri'i glang po ches zos na gla rtsi la sogs pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na ke ta ka'i me tog dri'i glang po ches zos na gla rtsi la sogs pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, when the ketaka flower is eaten by the fragrant elephant, it becomes musk and so forth.

original: glang po che phal pas zos na lci ba'i dngos por 'gyur ro; ;de bas na de la ko ta ka'i me tog gi skyon ma yin te /
analyzed: glang po che phal pas zos na lci ba'i dngos por 'gyur ro; ;de bas na de la ko ta ka'i me tog gi skyon ma yin te /
translated: When it is eaten by an ordinary elephant, it becomes dung. Therefore, it is not the fault of the ketaka flower.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa yang rnam par dag pa'i rim pa la gnas pas bsam pa'i khyad par gyi sbyor ba las khyad par du 'phags pa nyid kyi 'bras bu smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa yang rnam par dag pa'i rim pa la gnas pas bsam pa'i khyad par gyi sbyor ba las khyad par du 'phags pa nyid kyi 'bras bu smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, attachment and so on, when they are applied to the special intention of one who is established in the stages of purification, will ripen as a special result.

original: dper na / 'o ma sprul la sogs pas 'thungs na dug gi dngos por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / 'o ma sprul la sogs pas 'thungs na dug gi dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, milk, when drunk by a serpent, becomes a poisonous substance;

original: gzhan yang / skyes bus 'thungs na bdud rtsi'i dngos por skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang / skyes bus 'thungs na bdud rtsi'i dngos por skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but when drunk by a person, it becomes an elixir of immortality.

original: de ltar / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: de ltar / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Thus, son of noble family,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa bsam pa'i khyad par gyis rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir sbyor bas dngos po khyad par can gyi 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa bsam pa'i khyad par gyis rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir sbyor bas dngos po khyad par can gyi 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: attachment and so on, because they are naturally not wrong by the special intention, will give rise to a special result by application.

original: gang dang / gang khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyun gyi dngos po dang ldan pa de dang / de'i 'bras bu khyad du 'phags pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang dang / gang khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyun gyi dngos po dang ldan pa de dang / de'i 'bras bu khyad du 'phags pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Whatever special cause there is, that special result will arise.

original: dper na / ke ta ka la sogs pa de rnams kyi khyad par du 'phags pa'i rim pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: dper na / ke ta ka la sogs pa de rnams kyi khyad par du 'phags pa'i rim pa la gnas pa /
translated: For example, those such as the ketaka are situated in the stages of their superiority.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnam par @520b dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnam par @520b dag pa'o //
translated: The nature of desire and so forth is pure.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i thig le zhes bya ba rdzogs so ////
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i thig le zhes bya ba rdzogs so ////
translated: The great king of tantras called the Drop of the Glorious True Conjunction is complete.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po k'a ya stha pa ga ya dha ra'i zhal snga nas dang / bod kyi lotstsha ba dge slong sh'akya ye shes kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po k'a ya stha pa ga ya dha ra'i zhal snga nas dang / bod kyi lotstsha ba dge slong sh'akya ye shes kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
translated: The Indian abbot Kaya-sthavira Gayadhara and the Tibetan translator-cum-disciple, the monk Shakya Yeshe, translated, edited, and finalized it.

original: slad nas kyang bod kyi lotstsha ba gzhan rnams kyis bsgyur ba la zur mi 'dra bar bcos nas rang gi ming bcug cing /
analyzed: slad nas kyang bod kyi lotstsha ba gzhan rnams kyis bsgyur ba la zur mi 'dra bar bcos nas rang gi ming bcug cing /
translated: Later, other Tibetan translators made corrections to the translation, inserting their own names.

original: gzhan gyi ming 'phyi pa de dag dang / mi shes pa de dag sun dbyung ba'i phyir slad nas byang rgya gar gyi rgyud bzhi dang // dge slong sh'akya ye shes de nyid kyis gtugs nas bcos te gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ming 'phyi pa de dag dang / mi shes pa de dag sun dbyung ba'i phyir slad nas byang rgya gar gyi rgyud bzhi dang // dge slong sh'akya ye shes de nyid kyis gtugs nas bcos te gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: In order to refute those who have mispronounced the names of others and those who are ignorant, later on in the north, the four Indian tantras were consulted and corrected by the very same monk Śākya Ye-she.
